Reviews.Title: “HOTEL BONVECCHIATI”
Reviews.Author: Bob835
Reviews.Content: Booked in for period 6th April to 11th. Room with canal view. Two grandparents (70s) plus 11 year old grand daughter. Staff were excellent, very helplfull and polite. Food very good - we had the 5 course Easter lunch. Excellent range for breakfast. The hotel is very convenient for both St Marks Square (about 5 or 6 mins) and Rialto bridge (about 10 mins) Would certainly stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Bob E
Reviews.Content: Booked the room through Last Minute & were upgraded to a large clean room on the first floor in the annex which had a gorgeous view over canals on both sides. Woken up by the Gondolas in the morning! A bit of a bind was having to take the keys back to the hotel - 50m over the bridge. Breakfast was huge and varied although the coffee was not particularly great. Reception staff were very polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great central Venice location”
Reviews.Author: lighthouse110
Reviews.Content: We just had a two night stay here. Staff were very helpful indeed, best I've come across anywhere. Food was good, room nicely appointed, excellent location. One tip, make sure to book a room that is either over the restaurant or on opposite side of the canal. We were at the back, with canal view, which sounds good, but the reality is that out back (opposite to the hotel)there is some sort of daily barge and workmen that collect the rubbish at somewhat anti social times ! Would not put us off booking there again as long as we stayed round the other side ; )

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sundries123
Reviews.Content: we just spent 4 nights at this hotel, very well located.clean , helpful staff. to busy to feel very much personalised help.

Reviews.Title: “A MARVELLOUS LOCATION IN THE RIGHT ROOM”
Reviews.Author: TerryFWall
Reviews.Content: I think the very mixed reports for this hotel are largely based on which room you are allocated. My wife and I had a package from England with Citalia and were initially shown a fairly large room on the fourth floor overlooking rooftops, but not recently re-furbished. It would have been adequate but we wanted the real Venetian experience so asked for an upgrade, which we were offered for an additional 50 euros per night. The room was 328 and was exactly what we had hoped for a 3-night stay in Venice. On the classic photograph of the hotel, taken from the bridge, the room is on the corner, on the floor next to the top, and has one window facing the bridge and two windows overlooking the canal. Absolute magic, particularly when the singing gondoliers went by in the afternoon! The large gondola station is 100 metres down the joining canal on the way to St Mark's Square. So, if you want the best experience from the Bonvecchiati, splash out for one of these rooms. The breakfast is superb, everything you could want, eaten either inside or under the magnificent canopies, with heaters, which allow you to watch the locals hurrying to work over the bridge, and the laundry boat collecting all the sheets and towels. In any other city the laundry collection would be a nuisance - in Venice it's a novel sight worth seeing! We certainly weren't going to use the restaurant for any other meal, with set lunch at 35 and dinner 60. It's easy to get lost when you first arrive, even with the map from the hotel website, so here are the directions for those arrriving from the airport on the Alilaguna boat to Rialto (the best stop for this hotel, save Piazza San Marco for when you have dropped off your luggage). Remember, the pedestrian streets, even those that appear to be the main ones, are very narrow and close together, so you can easily go much too far looking for your turning. The map indicates that you walk along the grand canal before turning down a street towards the hotel, but this is not so from the Alilaguna stop. Immediately in front of you when you get off is a very narrow alleyway - this is the main thoroughfare you must take! If you arrive on the actv waterbus you do have to walk a few yards away from the Rialto bridge until you get to the Alilaguna stop, then down this passage. Keep straight on across the small square after about 100 metres, then continue along Calle Goldoni for a short walk. If you then take any of the small streets on your right, and turn left after 50 metres, you will be on the road to the Bonvecchiati. Past the Serenissima hotel and round the corner and you are there. The staff are very helpful - especially Patrizia a.k.a.Tricia, from Cortina d'Ampezzo via Brighton! The decor is charming, the lifts are minute and it's usually worth walking down rather than wait. The second floor was being renovated while we were there but it certainly didn't bother us. Our initial room 408 is button 4 on the lift - room 328 is higher up and button 5! We just wanted to roam around and get the ambience of the city, which was busy with tourists despite being only March - summer must be awful, but in Spring you can soon find places that seem well away from the crowds. On a walk in Dursoduro we bought sandwiches and water from a cafe window and found a private garden attached to a museum and sat there in total peace to have our lunch, then used their washroom facilities, all free of charge. A good suggestion, if you are able to be very flexible with your trip, would be to check the ten-day forecasts for Venice online then book when you see a few days sunshine predicted. Prices for a package via Citalia from the UK seem reasonable in Spring, and there are offers such as a fourth night or room upgrade free. You might even get a last-minute special offer - we saw a deal in the Telegraph and booked from that. It was under Â£300 each for three nights B&B and a return EasyJet flight from Gatwick, plus the room upgrade at around Â£65 and the Alilaguna from the airport for 24 euros return - you save a euro and can walk straight out of the airport past those queueing at the desk and down to the pier (10 minutes, undercover) and change your voucher there. Total cost around Â£370, much cheaper than when we thought of going last September, the quotes for two were well over Â£1000. Finally, take full advantage of the timed passes for the waterbus. You can buy a 24, 36 or 48 hour pass (or longer) with unlimited trips on the actv vaporetto all over the lagoon. We found the 36 hour pass the best value as you can buy it in late morning one day and use it until your final trip back after dinner the following evening - all for 23 euros. As a single trip, even just one stop, is 6.50 euros it has to be good value, and you can explore as much as you like, getting off and on many times. Do not forget to validate your pass every time you get on! You only have to hold each ticket up to a machine while you are waiting, but you do not want a 52 euro fine. I don't know if they would insist, if you have a valid ticket, but I suggest you don't try to find out. We were not visiting the interiors of the buildings so two days, plus the afternoon and evening of arrival, was just sufficient to explore the San Marco district, and Dursoduro on the other side of the grand canal, on one day, and take the waterbus out to Murano and then another to Burano on day 2. Burano is a must-see (we avoided the "free" trip out to Murano by private boat then two hours in a glass factory and find your own way back!). I have also reported on the Grand Canal, and the Taverna San Trovaso in Dursoduro, separately, if you want to check those out. I'm sure we'll go back some day to take in all the art treasures, and would be very happy in room 328 in the Bonvecchiati. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Bonvecchiati Hotel Venice”
Reviews.Author: ArtTeacher_12
Reviews.Content: I took a school party 2 weeks ago for a 3 night stay in this gorgeous hotel. The hotel is 2 mins from St Mark's square which is a real bonus. The hotel itself is very well run, the reception was very welcoming. We were expecting our students to be squashed into twin rooms with a 'put up' bed for the third student but this was n't the case, the rooms were big and extremely well equipped except for a kettle. The breakfasts were amazing we had such a cosmopolitan choice, I loved the fresh fruit and very yellow scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: gianlorenzo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed the combination of professionalism and friendliness displayed by the staff as well as the high-quality accommodation. The hotel is perfectly located for the visitor to Venice: S.Marco is only 5 minutes away as is the Rialto Bridge. The breakfasts lack inspiration, but are generous and satisfying. The rooms, and hotel in general, are spotlessly clean and beautifully furnished. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BLanceG
Reviews.Content: What with a simple room in Venice costing upwards of 300 Euro a night now, we found the Bonvecchiati not only a good value but a lucky find. Conveniently located, very modern, comfortable & courteous staff, we lacked nothing. Throw in an included daily breakfast & a 200 Euro daily rate, and you're set. They even had free internet (albeit ONE computer) for guests in lobby lounge. We'd absolutely stay again with ONE exception: do NOT book airport water taxi thru hotel (extra 50 Euro charge EACH way). You can easily obtain water taxi at Venice airport service desk just outside baggage. Get a business card from water taxi & for return trip to airport have hotel call about an hour before. Save the "hotel booking fee" ("kickback") of 100 Euro..you can have a nice dinner on that! We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for tourists, poor for business”
Reviews.Author: David_W_Alexander
Reviews.Content: The Bonvecchiati Hotel is superb for families or friends travelling to Venice. Situated perfectly in the heart of Venice, a few minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square, it's a great base from which to see this magical city. The room we had was superb, with a huge and luxurious bathroom. It looked out on one of the maze of canals and while there could be some noise from the boats going past, the double glazing kept it pretty quiet. If you want silence, don't come to Venice anyway! It was a shame that the restaurant was closed but there were a handful of decent places within a couple of minutes walk but the breakfast, with hot and cold foot to suit all tastes, was again first class. We inquired about a boat trip to the islands to see the glass blowing and the Hotel offered one free of charge which took us tehre and brought us back. Of course there's always a bit of pressure for the sell when you do one of these trips, and I've done them a couple of times before, but everyone was very courteous. I only have one gripe about this hotel and that is the internet. While it was a holiday, there are times when I needed to check in for work emails. In this day and age of iPads and portable devices, I really would expect a fairly decent level of service. I paid for 20 hours of internet but it was worse than some internet I've had in deepest Africa. Everything was slow, emails wouldn't send or download and when I finally got impatient and went to use the lobby computer, even that couldn't cope with downloading a PDF I needed. Eventually I had to ask to use the office computer which the staff kindly let me do, but, for one reason or another, that too didn't work. That said, if you don't need computers or internet - and a lot of people don't - this would be a great place to stay and one of the better hotels in venice I have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Choice If the Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: 1aCruise4wks
Reviews.Content: This hotel met my basic needs. Location is great. A 2-min walk straight out the door gets you to Hard Rock Cafe, another minute later you're at the side entrance to San Marco Plaza. In the same amount of time in a different direction and you can be at Rialto Bridge. The room was clean in all respects. The bed was comfortable. We had plenty of hot water and the shower put out a good stream. The included breakfast was very extensive, including eggs made to order. The rooms are small just like other European hotels that I've stayed in. The hotel is being updated. We travelled with another couple and I saw their room (I've included pix of both rooms). Their bathroom has been redone very nicely. The hotel staff are very friendly. I contacted them by email before our stay and they arranged for a transfer from the airport to the hotel (at my cost, of course). The hotel has its own dock so the water taxi could drop us off right at the hotel dock. For other hotels w/o docks, the taxi drops you off at the Grande Canal and you schlep your luggage through the streets to get to the hotel. The staff was just as friendly once we were there. The restaurant staff weren't as friendly but they were efficient/effective. CONS: As is true of many hotels in Venice, it is very old and it shows. But, some might view that as "character". There were radiators in the bathroom & main room which seemed to be the heat but there was also a heat/air unit hanging on the wall. The radiator was always on in the bathroom and I couldn't turn it off. It turned out okay because it rained all the time we were in Venice so it gave us a place to dry our clothes. I didn't notice the unit hanging on the wall until day 2 and it took me awhile to figure out how to use the remote control to work the unit. Not a big deal 'cause it was October and we could just open the window for cooling. I never could get the TV to work but we didn't spend much time in the room. The elevators were extremely small - max of 4 if you're good friends (or you will be). Some of the prices I saw for this hotel when we were planning the trip were very expensive but our travel agent managed to get us a good rate. I'd stay there again if I could get the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 strars!”
Reviews.Author: Costantin B
Reviews.Content: During my trip to Italy this is the place I stayed in Venice. The room was small and we asked to changed but staff refused,the breakfast ok but not 4 stra hotel choice. The price we payed too high for the service 100Euros. But Venice is very expensive for everything. Cleaness not the best. I think the hotel have to do more to reflect the 4 strars they have. Staff is correct. The location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Itchy Headache with a bad back - great location tho honest”
Reviews.Author: Widz1
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel if you can, it is not a 4 star hotel . Highlights: Location is perfect - 5mins from San marco & Rialto . Staff - Among the more polite we met on our visit to Venice. Disasters: Bedbugs - woke up on final morning with bites all over. Come back from a holiday with itchy bite marks is not what I expected. Noise - the place sounds like a bomb goes off every ten mins from 6am ; I think this is down to the builders work going on outside the front entrance Facilities - Bar is never open and consists of three old bottles of wine on a shelf anyway. Restaurant is closed for refurbishment . Our stay was in Nov 2011 , this work seems to be going on a long time as it was mentioned in previous reviews on here (Nov 2010) No tea or coffee facilities in the rooms, ordered room service once for a cuppa out of desperation only to have a cold cup of below average coffee and tea delivered. Single Beds pushed together to form a double. It was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in, not one good nights sleep, a gondola would have been more comfortable. We enjoyed Venice as a city and the location and staff of the hotel were good so this rating is not a reflection on them. It is just that this hotel is far from a four star, it's a two star at best and really needs so much work done on so many aspects that I would leave this one for a few years, who knows the restaurant might be finished by then. Avoid .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrDarwin
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the San Marco Sestieri for the classic tourist attractions in the Rialto, San Marco, Academia triangle. Our room was small but comfortable and clean, seemingly noisy, but most-likely as there isn't any traffic noise. No bar, restaurant or water-gate due to refurbishment. NOT a four-star hotel, or even three-star ! Not a long weekend nighmare, but certainly not what we expected or paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Venice travelers”
Reviews.Author: Mpvlaw
Reviews.Content: This is a newly remodeled hotel, at least from its views. It has a sister property, the Palace Bonvecchiati where the eating facilities are located. The hotels do connect between each other on the first floor of the Hotel. What I believe sets this Hotel apart from others, is the staff of the Hotel. The desk staff is excellent for solving problems, for making suggestions and for answering any inquiry. And they do go the extra mile for meeting the guest's expectations. We had one large room, divided by a semi partition for a desk. The mattress was excellent, and the bathroom accommodations were big with both a shower and a tub. However, other rooms did not have both, just a tub with a hand held shower. The hotel is pricey, but what is not at San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: viajando1675
Reviews.Content: Not too easy to reach from train station (as almost anything in Venice), but great hotel. Very close to Piazza San Marco. Clean, smoothy rooms. Great breakfast. The TV in the room does not fit very good in the space (designed for old 14" tv sets), but, no problem with that. Very kind and elegant people at reception desk. Our room was not ready when we arrived (at 13:00), but we waited only for 20 minutes. We booked at a well known booking website, and (as usual in our experience, except one or two times), we were not disappointed: there was an offer for the double room, and the bill was accurate. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not to be recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Liz P
Reviews.Content: I was prepared to pay more for a good 4* hotel in Vencie as it was a special holiday. I booked the Bonvecchiati hotel, but didn't get stay there! On arrival we told we were given a 'free' upgrade to the Residence. A case of over booking perhaps??? This is a very disappointing residence block with no amenities, you are given a front door key, a terrible odour of sewage on enterring the block and the vary basic of rooms - not worthy of a 3* rating!. To go to breakfast meant leaving the accommodation block and walking down the road. There was do direct telephone line to the hotel's reception desk, and the furnishing were very cheap and not really cheerful. There was no hot water, this had been turned off, and the lights didn't work. No sense of urgency in coming to put this right. On the plus side, a great location! don't be fooled by the pictures in brochures or the official website, if our experience is typical you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SouthAustraliaAussie
Reviews.Content: As you can read from other reviewers that the location is fantastic. The breakfast is the best we experienced so far. Fresh made eggs while you wait. Selection like no other. The staff were lovely and worked quite efficiently considering how busy the hotel is. Our room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom had everything you needed even a toothbrush. Fabulous hotel we wished we had more time to stay longer. Oh enjoy the grumpy and pushy locals(the older ones) when you go on to a water bus as they will push you out of the way to get a seat!

Reviews.Title: “Not great stay but good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Prijain13
Reviews.Content: I was asked to stay in another room which was away from the hotel and it was like a hostel. Coffee machine was not working, TV was not operating. It was not worth staying in this hotel. Only good part about this hotel was staying in center of the island. Service wasnt good too. however enjoyed breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PapaOregon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of a tour of Croatia. Great place to stay to see the sights of Venice. It was our first time to Venice, and we appreciated bein so close to San Marco Aquare and the Rialto Bridge. Spent alot of time on the other side of the canal which is a bit less crowded. The hotel is a very busy place with many tours groups using it. Sometimes breakfast was a bit noisy, but the food was great. Rooms were simple but adequate. It is more expensive because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: VPham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of October 2011. First time to Venice. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is only a 3-5 minute walk to either San Marco Square or Rialto Bridge, with gondolas just outside the entrance. The rooms are clean, well furnished and a decent size. Each of the rooms has an LCD TV with Sky satellite. The buffet breakfast is very good with lots of variety and an egg stand where your eggs cooked any style. Only two complaints about Albergo Bonveccchiati. First, service is not at all friendly. None of the staff, with the exception of the kind cleaning lady, smiles even if you try to be friendly. When you speak to the staff, you get the feeling that you are wasting their time. In the end I felt more comfortable going to the tourist information office in San Marco Square to ask for directions and suggestions. Second, the bathroom had sewage back-up problems. Most mornings and evenings you could smell sewage eminating from the drains.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurie H
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop of our two week trip to Italy. We showed up at the hotel and without asking we were immediately upgraded to a fantastic room. The breakfasts in the morning were top notch. The location is fantastic because it is near everything. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Delight!”
Reviews.Author: nsgMumbai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Bonvecchiati for three nights.We had a smallish room...not complaining..as we had the canal view.The view certainly made up for the space constraint!The hotel is located at a five minute walk from the st Mark's square. Everything is just a walk away. This made sure we could just drop by at the hotel in the middle of the day and quickly continue again to exploring Venice. The bathroom was spacious and had all amenities needed. The restaurant was really good. Breakfast was up to the mark with friendly staff. They even held up a dinner reservation for us for over an hour! While leaving Venice, we had an early train, and the staff packed breakfast for us too. Good stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dajtodd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were delighted with the hotel. When visiting Venice you are not likely to spend much time in your hotel therefore, when there, you want comfort, good service and good facilities. At this hotel the double room was very comfortable. The beds were spacious, the bathroom contained all that you needed. The skye television was available free for the rugby world cup.There was a well stocked mini bar and the maid service was excellent. The self service breakfast was varied with hot and cold food available in a beautiful Terrace room. I would recommend this hotel to anybody as a base to explore this beautiful city. From our room we could watch the gondolas passing by and in fact the hotel had a pick up point for water taxis, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mark h
Reviews.Content: This place has the rudest staff you will ever have the displeasure of meeting. We were there last weekend and from the minute we walked in, where they couldn't even be bothered to greet us with a hello, to the minute we left and tried to complain about the beds that we had also fallen inbetween (twin beds made up to look like doubles) and received the answer "well that's how it is" This place is a disgrace. The rooms were clean, but no better standard than a Travel lodge in the uk.The one and only thing this Hotel got right was the photographer they used to make it look good.

Reviews.Title: “JUST OK”
Reviews.Author: Erin R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in mid September. The location was wonderful, two "blocks" from St. Marks Square. Very easy walk to the Square in the evening for music and drinks. The rooms (we had 2) were OK. About average size compared to others I've stayed in in Italy. I thought the staff were friendly and helpful enough. With that said, given the euros it cost for each night, I was expecting abit nicer hotel. But never having stayed in Venice before, I don't have anything to compare it to.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location and experience.”
Reviews.Author: ANANDKMOORTHY
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights starting Sept. 16. It was nice and conveniently located. The hotel is walking distance from the Rialto water taxi stand and also the Rialto bridge as well as the Piazza St. Marco. We stayed at room 314, with a pathetic view of other rooms. Even though the room is very small -- no place to keep suitcases and other bags if you are traveling heavy -- the far corner wouldnâ€™t get much cool under the air conditioning. The service is okay -- we asked for a water kettle, they forgot to deliver, and did so only after a reminder 24 hours later. The breakfast spread is very nice and the hotel is surrounded by lots of eatouts and shops. Gondola rides are also easy from the hotel, and approach to the hotel by a private taxi is about 15 minutes ride through the grand canal and also the side canal. The hotel offers wifi, 6 euros for 60 minutes. The bathroom is well appointed, although the tiny shower area has no curtains or door. Be prepared to get your bathroom marble wet all the time you shower up.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Starks551
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrible! The staff is very rude, the rooms are small and the put two single beds together to make it like a queen size bed. Both me and my wife fell in between the middle. When we asked to upgrade the guy looked at as and said no. The carpets are dirty as well as the chairs. Never again will we stay here. Four no way try like two.

Reviews.Title: “ALERT Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah P
Reviews.Content: We saw the picture and read the reviews. It was a bait and switch! We were put in the old section of the hotel. The rooms were small and dirty, and the staff was extremely rude! We walked through to the Palace side to see if we could upgrade our room. We were sized up and told absolutely not! The bed in our room was a double size. We had a wardrobe for our clothes and a highboy for tv viewing and small minibar. The floors were dirty and the mat for the shower floor had mildew on it. There was 1 computer for the hotel which cost 6 Euros for 1 hour of use. The restaurant was only ok. The furniture in the lobby was also very dirty. The only plus was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryIsrael
Reviews.Content: We were greatly concerned, as most people who book Venetian hotels, of how we were going to lug heavy suitcases and bags through the alleyways of Venice. Our main concern was how we would negotiate the myriad of steps that take people from one side of the many canals to the other. Our worries were aggravated by arriving into Venice by cruise ship and not receiving helpful information. It turned out we worried for nothing. As we pulled our suitcases out of the port terminal we quickly found ourselves at the waterside stations for the Venetian water buses and the highly expensive water taxis. When we discovered that a water taxi could take us, and our luggage, right up to the hotel we decided to pay the 110 Euro and enjoy the experience of being ferried to our hotel in central Venice. Believe me. It's worth the money. From ship to hotel was fun and we arrived at our hotel in style. Bonvecchiati turned out to be a four minute stroll to St. Mark's Square and about double that to the Rialto Bridge. It is literally in the heart of Venice. The reception service was courteous, friendly, and prompt. We had the usual problem trying to operate the safe in our room, and they came within minutes and helped us through the process. Why do I always feel so stupid when I fail to open and close these safes on arrival in my hotel rooms? The hotel has a large breakfast room with lots of selection. We preferred to sit out of the large patio and there was always room. This patio terrace makes for a pleasant place to eat an evening meal, though we preferred to eat out as we explored our favourite city. This is a hotel that we can recommend, I wouldn't say that the rooms are ultra modern but, hey, this is Venice. Right?

Reviews.Title: “Miserable hotel staff and bathrooms from hell”
Reviews.Author: Arthur P
Reviews.Content: Beware of this hotel. The rooms are tiny and the bathroom is a visit from 1960. The maid refused to clean the room one day because my kids left their suitcases open and on the floor. The "concierge" sent us to a restaurant that was closed. And then the "pseudoconcierge" sent me on the wrong boat to the airport, costing me 75 additional euros for my family of 5, after paying for a different boat. They just couldn't care less at this hotel, and it really seemed like the guests were really a nuisance. This attitude extended to the restaurant. Though the breakfast was outstanding, the waitresses do not understand the meaning of "hospitality", joining the other hotel staff in their apparent hatred for guests. Oh, and the wireless internet? Try 6 euros for an hour! Give me a break.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: kalisana55
Reviews.Content: 1.take a public transport water bus to hotel....an hour or so and slow but 25 euros return buy it at airport it's cheaper by 5 euros. 2.Please arrive in day time otherwise the walk is 15-20 min and no body to help you in the dark it can be very difficult walk to hotel from the st marks square water bus station. 3.Once at the hotel the reception staff is excellent and ask for the Free trip to Murano island to see glass factory this way you'll get a free ride in a water boat James Bond style fast! 4.Breakfast is excellent but can get crowded so arrive early and take a sit in the corner along the canal where you can see gondoliers taking people for an early morning ride the scene is fabulous and you could take lovely photos here,it really is a fantastic location along the canal. 5.If you arrive hungry at night ask reception address for late night pizzeria which is just round the corner from st marks sq open 24/7 and serves reasonable price pizza deals but you have to sit in st marks sq and eat. 6.Once you are in the hotel all the local sites are within reach of walking distance so very convenient. 7.lifts are a bit small so coming down in morning for breakfast you may have to walk down but not a problem. 8.Rooms are good however shower a bit cramped but managed ok. 9.scene from windows spectacular on 5th floor. Overall,excellent value for money and very convenient to rialto bridge, st marks sq.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HappyflowerKent_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights at the end of July before we went down to Rome. The hotel could not be in a better position, all of the staff were excellent and breakfast beside the canal would be hard to beat. We would definately stay here again if (hopefully when) we come back to Venice and would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to relatives and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoon201107
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for part of our honeymoon. This was a hotel upgrade that we made through Monograms travel. I was worried because of so many mixed reviews, but when we got there, my wife and I couldn't be happier. The staff was welcoming and friendly. This was our first trip to Europe and was told by our travel agent that hotels are not what we are used to in the US. Our room was decent in size and had a nice view of the canal. It definitely had an old world feeling. The room was very clean and yes, there are no queen size beds here. Beds consists of two twins beds pushed together. This is what we experienced in each of the three hotels we stayed in while we were in Italy. Enough can not be said about this hotels location. You are so close to St. Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. Didn't have dinner at the restaurant, but their breakfast was the best we had while in Italy. If we ever make it back to Venice, we will be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading practice showing to much nicer rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ben1961
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed by the misleading approach of this hotel. Having looked at the specific â€œSuperiorâ€� room/bathroom pictures on booking.com I booked a Superior room for the 3 children. These show a spacious, luxury looking room with high ceiling. Instead they got narrow depressing room on the rooftop, with a small window (I took pictures that speak for themselves available on request). Because the tiny elevator stopped on the floor below, we had to carry the luggage up to a narrow staircase. I was not taken serious by the Director of sales, Fabio Bottacin, who did not see a problem in the fact we had received another room than the one I clicked on at the time of the reservation, â€œbecause all rooms are differentâ€� & â€œthis is Venice. Donâ€™t expect too much â€�. He tried to make me believe we even had a free â€œDeluxeâ€� upgrade. I do not understand why this upgrade was still far below the â€œSuperiorâ€� picture shown on Booking.com. Since at check-in in the morning I was asked to sign the already made Mastercard receipt, even before having seen the room that was not cleaned yet, I had no means of pressure or possibility to refuse the room. Mr Bottacin remark that the pictures shown on the internet usually are untrustworthy surprises me. In the last 2 months Iâ€™ve booked 20 hotel rooms. Only the one in Bonvecchiati (by far) wasnâ€™t up to the booking.com promise. I can suggest Mr Bottacin to go and have a look at for example at Pesaro Palace and compare the 2 person room with extra bed at a slightly higher price than Bonvecchiati. For my experience the 8,2 score is strongly overrated. I hope Booking.com can put an end to this shameless & misleading approach.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: sochatai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very lovely old hotel. It is in two parts. We had to take the elevator up to the third floor to get to the second floor where our room was located down a short flight of stairs. The staff was nice and helpful. The room is small. We had two twin beds together and our daughter had a fold out bed at the feet of our beds. The bathroom was roomy. Don't expect this to be a typical roomy American room. There isn't a coffee pot, wash cloth or clock in the room. Our room overlooked a canal and we did have the windows open. If you like to sleep in, close the outside shutters as there wern't room darkening curtains in our room. The light fixtures are glass, so I would not recommend this hotel for parents with active kids.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous loved every moment”
Reviews.Author: nunuLiverpool
Reviews.Content: A lovely Hotel, real traditional feel to it. Well decorated and our room was lovely. I have read reviews complaining the rooms were not big but ours was big enough for us two. We had a canal view which was interesting as we watched Gondola's delivering goods to hotels. The staff in Reception were very helpful and very pleasant, they all spoke very good English and other languages. The dining room is lovely as it is partly out side, the breakfast was very good , lots of variety hot or cold. I would love to go back there and hope to do so next May

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED, VERY SMALL Rundown Rooms but a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Susi14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in July 2011 and I have never been so disappointed with a hotel room for the money that I paid! I can't describe to you how TINY these rooms are and how rundown they look. Let's just say that our "King Size" bed was really a full size bed and it took up about 80% of the room. The bathroom was a joke and the shower was disgusting! Restaurant: We ate at the restaurant our last night and we were happy with the food. The restaurant itself is nice, updated, has great service and has great food & wine. I would definitely recommend the restaurant at the hotel to friends but I would never recommend the hotel itself. If it wasn't for the great location (1 minute walk to Piazza San Marco) then I would have rated this hotel "Terrible" with 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Never had a smaller room, my dorm room was bigger! 4 stars? No way!!”
Reviews.Author: 4_star_traveler558
Reviews.Content: We wanted to extend our stay in Venice and, unfortunately, had to vacate our very reasonably priced suite at the Starhotel Splendid. What' s unbelievable is that the front desk at the Starhotel Splendid got us the room at the nearby Bonvecchiati Hotel. We trusted them when we were informed that the accomodations would not be the same as what we were leaving but as they stated, the Bonvecchiati was, never the less, a 4 star hotel. In my travels throughout Asia, Europe, South America, islands and the USA, I can with totally honesty never did I have a smaller room & bath at any hotel (or dorm in college, for that matter)! I have trusted and relied on the star rating but for this hotel to have 4 stars is a total travesty! The staff was also not helpful and had an real attitude when I commented about the room. Also, the carpeting in the halls was shabby and torn and large bags of something cluttered the halls. I am not one to complain or write reveiws but travelers need to be warned about the Bonvecchiati Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Paradox2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Monograms tour and had an excellent experience. The staff was responsive, the breakfast delicious and plentiful, and the room was great, but we may have lucked out because we had a triple room which afforded us two bedrooms with a walk in closet and marble bathroom with two lavatories. We would definitely stay here again, especially considering it's perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic setting in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: hipsoccermom
Reviews.Content: We loved this romantic spot for our 10th anniversary trip to Italy. Great location & service!

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugged”
Reviews.Author: Sindhu17
Reviews.Content: I wish I had done this review earlier....My colleague and I stayed at this hotel quite some time ago. While on the surface everything looked charming and elegant, I had one of the worst experiences here. We had a very early morning boat drop to the airport. On waking up, I observed spots of blood all over the sheets and pillowcases. On looking closer, I noticed the bed, head board and the walls were crawling with bedbugs. I was bitten with swellings all over me. On checking, my colleague too was bitten but not as badly. Told the person at the front desk and showed him the bites while checking out. Early in the morning, I got no reaction from him and I suspect he did not understand english too well. On returning to my country, I was put on steriod injections to counter the effects of the bites. Infestation of this kind is terrible for a hotel to have. Hygiene is crucial and a hotel cant be all charming externally and totally lacking with housekeeping . Because of this incident, everything else that the hotel was about, including the good location, was discounted. I dont know if this problem was just in a few rooms or not, but I hope since then, the hotel has done something to eradicate this serious problem as I would not wish this on any unsuspecting guest.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Room I've Had In Years”
Reviews.Author: Dub1955
Reviews.Content: I was fooled into booking this hotel as an upgrade with Monograms Travel based on the photos provided by the hotel. The room I was issued in no way resembled the photos except there were four walls. The "double" bed was two twin beds, made up as twin beds, and then shoved together. There was not enough room between the bed and the walls for two people to pass unless one stepped out of the room. The bathroom was the size of an RV bathroom, and like other reviews the shower curtain was too short and the bathroom floor flooded when used - I guess that's why there was a floor drain behind the toilet. I removed some of the shower curtain hooks to use on the remainder to help lower the curtain but it was still too short. The closet was a minimum-security prison-style built-in and essentially unusable for hanging clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Way over rated”
Reviews.Author: retiredinflorida11
Reviews.Content: Room was a converted closet. Only big enough for a bed and one night stand. Small TV on top of stand so could not be seen when in the small double bed. Mattress was soft and saggy. Noise from street was very loud, even at 11pm. Bathroom shower flooded the entire bathroom as the curtain would not reach the floor. No room to store your suitcases, constantly tripping over them. We had two other rooms occupied by family and all were worse than ours. The staff was curt (not friendly). Even the elevator was small, could only squeeze two people and no luggage in. Only plus was the location. For all this, the price was over $400 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisa008
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, we were able to walk to St Marks square in a couple of minutes and the Rialto bridge was very close too. We spent our time walking around the major sites of Venice very easily and got a 12 hour waterbus pass which took us out to the islands of Burano and Torcello. After that we used the pass to go up and down the grand canal. the hotel room we had was on the fourth floor. It was newly decorated and roomy. We looked out over the canal and bridge. it was great to see the gondolas and service vehicles coming past all the time. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful at all times and loved the breakfast but you need to get in to breakfast fairly early otherwise it is very busy.We took our own kettle because neither here or in our Rome hotel were there any tea/coffee making facilities. Apparantly it is considered to be a health and safety risk to provide them in Italy!! We didn't use the restaurant during our stay but enjoyed meals locally, the Teatro Goldoni cafe very close to the hotel provided us with excellent food. The bed was on the firm side and the service boats do start up early but we wanted to be up early to explore so that was fine. Don't miss the doges palace. the tickets are 14 euros but do include other museums on the square. one disappointment was that the bridge of sighs is partially covered up for repair. At least you can cross it if you do the palace.

Reviews.Title: “Location! This is it. Stay no other place in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: kywillia
Reviews.Content: After a week in Roma, we fisted Venice. The key here is to stay as close to the Square as possible for obvious reasons. The square is where everything happens. Really impressed with the Sauna. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on the food. Rooms were very large for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in this hotel if you want a decent night sleep - Not a 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: PLYOOC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a weekend trip to celebrate my 30th Bday, as it was a 4* we thought that we couldn't go wrong even after reading a couple of bad reviews on trip advisor. We were wrong. To cut a long story short, I would 100% NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm not one for writing hotel reviews but I wouldn't want anyone else's trip to Venice to be spoilt by choosing this hotel, it was awful. This is definatly not a 4* hotel, 2-3* at best. Although I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone it would be unfair not to mention a couple of 'good points'. LOCATION - This hotel is in a very good location and is 5 mins walk from St Marco Piazza and the main tourist attractions. SERVICE - The front desk staff were always very friends as were the dining room staff. BREAKFAST - Mixed opinions about the food. It consisted of streaky bacon swimming in oil, very very mushy scrambled egg, cold meat and cheese, fresh fruit salad, yogurt, toast, bread and croissant/pain au chocolat (which were very nice). Tea and coffee and diluted juices were avaliable. An A la carte menue was also avaliable but very very expensive, but included fresh juice, sausage, fried egg. Now the bad points, sorry a little long, have tried to keep it as concise as possible; ROOM & NOISE -The room we were in was nothing like the photos show when booking or those in the hotel brouchure, it was terrible, it was very small, there were dirty marks on the walls and curtains and one part of the wooden floor was missing. You needed to shuffle sideways to walk past the wardrobe to get into the bed the space was that limited. The windows in the room rattled as did the door even when it was locked, so all night long you could hear a very loud rattling sound. Even though the window shutters were closed and we were on the third floor the noise from the street below was so loud it was as if the people were in the same room. Sound insulation between rooms was also poor and even the smallest of noises could be heard clearly. No tea and coffee making facilities which I would expect from a 4* hotel and would have been nice after a days sight seeing. I think that some of the rooms are being refurbed and the rooms are desperate need of this. BUILDING WORK - Building work was being undertaken at the time of our stay, which meant the restaurant was closed, we had to listen to drilling whilst eating our breakfast and the bar was closed. TV - When booking the hotel information said Satallite TV. The only channel in English was CNN and the signal was lost on a regular basis. Films were avaliable on the pay channels for 7 euro each. The TV itself was very small. TEMPERATURE - The room was very very hot. I like the heat but it was even too warm for me, this also stopped us sleeping properly. The air conditioning system didn't work either. BATHROOM - This was a wet room and again very very small and the whole room became wet and slippy after taking a shower. There was bath. There was no hair dryer as stated in the hotel details and we were not given any shower gel only bath foam! BED - We booked a double room and got two single beds pushed together which moved in the night and each morning one of us woke up in the large gap between the beds! SLEEP - We were woken at between 6 and 7 am each day by the noise from the street, rattling door/windows and people in the neighbouring room waking up and being able to hear every little sound eg conversations and sneezes. I was keen to leave this hotel and get home for a decent night sleep. Good luck of you choose this hotel, and remember your ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NeilTrudy
Reviews.Content: I can echo the previous reviewer, the grumpy people who left earlier reviews are talking rubbish. Generaly the hotel is clean the staff efficient,and perfectly located for tourists in Venice: Our room on the fourth floor was lovely but on the small side, with a view of the front street; the room was clean and had all the facilities we would have expected, including nice touches such as bath robes and slippers. Breakfast was suffcient - no-one mentioned their was a chef on hand to do specials, but the hot and cold buffet selection was Top tips for venice: get a day pass for the water-buses; don't expect good food; Although the city is geared up to fleece tourists with exhobetant prices - do go for a 15euro bellini at Harry's Bar! Dont get a room next to drunk americans (they shout at each other 'till 4am)

Reviews.Title: “High 3 Stars - an objectively, optimist review! (albeit long)”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2trvl_7
Reviews.Content: I must admit after reading the harsh previous reviews about their terrible experiences I did attempt to cancel my reservations prior to my trip. Since the hotel had already booked the first night on my credit card I decided to stay at least one night and make my own opinions. Luckily I listened to my sixth sense and upon my arrival at the hotel I was glad that I kept my reservation for my entire trip. Below is a very honest and objective opinion of my recent stay (10/29 â€“ 11/2) at the Hotel Bonvechiatti in Venice, Italy. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION: The best asset of this hotel is itsâ€™ location. I decided to splurge and take a private boat from VCE airport to the hotel ($110Euro but well worth it). I didnâ€™t want to worry about finding the location on my own schlepping luggage in a new, foreign city with no cab service!. I arrived @ 11:30am and my room was not ready â€“ no harm since check in was not for hours (@2pm). I had the bellhops take my luggage and decided to walk around St. Marcâ€™s Square and stop for lunch at a restaurant on the Grand Canal until I returned to the hotel at @ 2:30pm. The 2 major sites â€“ Rialto Bridge and St. Marcâ€™s Square are within EASY walking distances from the hotel. Again, the location of the hotel made it an "excellent choice" for my first visit to Venice . ROOM: My hotel room was #404 and I took the â€œsmallest elevator on earthâ€� with the very professional bellhop who carried my bags to my room. Upon entry I was astonished at the small size of the room. I have never stayed in a hotel room so small but again I had read the previous posts about the small rooms so I said â€œWhen in Veniceâ€¦â€� and put it in the back of my mind. The room was CLEAN, well attended, mini-bar stacked; closet space and hangers sufficient for the amount of clothing I packed, and the bathroom amenities were plentiful and appropriate. The bathroom (also small yet functional) had a heating rack for the towels, hair dryer on the wall, windows that fully opened, magnifying mirror for make-up, SMALL bathtub (which I did not use), free standing shower head (took a day to get used to it without wetting the floor), a body weight scale (also did not use â€“ WHY would I on vacation?!), extra toilet paper, plunger, and plenty of lighting. Again, also the smallest bathroom Iâ€™ve ever used but no complaints. BED: VERY comfortable for me. I found it hard to get up after my afternoon siesta from my AM activities and it was a nice Full sized bed (not the 2 beds together). There were plenty of blankets to use if needed and the sheets were 'kind to the skin' (NOT 500 thread count but comfortable). TV: I was a bit disappointed that the only English speaking channel was CNN (International) but I was never there to watch TV anyway so again, no harm. The movie (Pay Per view) selection was current although I didnâ€™t watch any of them. The TV wasnâ€™t a large, flat screen but medium sized, conventional format which was fine based on the size of the room. HEAT: THIS IS THE HOTEL TO STAY IN IF YOU LIKE HEAT!! My room was warm from the first day to the last day of my stay. I did not use the extra blanket (unless I wanted to feel like I was sleeping in a sauna). I love the heat (even during sleep) so definitely no complaints in this area. BREAKFAST: Not sure I can relate to the complaints about the food selection but I found it adequate. Each AM a chef was available to make eggs based on your preference (omelet, easy side up, scrambled, etc.). Cold food was the most abundant with your selection of cheeses, meats, smoked nova, grilled vegetables (new for me as a breakfast choice), cereals, pastries, toast/toaster, yogurts, fruits, coffee, and a variety of juices. I found the breakfast buffet selection more than adequate. I would rank it higher if they offered Prosecco (for a tasty Mimosa) and pancakes/waffles. FRONT DESK: Always courteous and professional customer support; and when my bathroom lights burned out they fixed them immediately. I did not experience any "snobbery" from the front desk staff AT ALL! Special Note: The two primary male front desk Associates were tall and quite handsome which made it a pleasure to hand in my room key upon leaving, and retrieving it upon my return to the hotel! All in all it was a pleasant stay â€“ if youâ€™re looking for 4-5 star luxury accommodations hotel then you will be disappointed - point blank. A solid 3 star is fair and appropriate. I would return to this hotel if Iâ€™m watching my budget and would prefer to splurge on fine dining and private boat travel to and from the hotel (which is how I wanted to experience Venice for the first time!).

Reviews.Title: “Moldly, Sad, and Poorly Maintained”
Reviews.Author: bailliejk
Reviews.Content: Due to the volcano flaring up and all flights being cancelled, hotel selection was slim when comming of the cruise ship. The only birght spot of this trip was Fabio at the Rialto boat stop who portered our luggage to and from the hotel. Worth the money. As for this hotel the only redeeming quality was that is had hot showers. The bathroom smell of black mold. We had to keep our bathroom door shut or the room was permiated with it. Our room opened on to a courtyard we could not see becuase of pipes covering the window. Also, we could not keep our windows open because the employees would go to the courtyard to smoke. The two rooms I rented 3 nights where horriable. Both beds had no give, and must of been at least 20 years old. The pictures you see in their add...the lobby looks like in the picture...but the rest of the hotel...burn the place to the ground. I can tell you in both rooms you had little floor space to get around the bed, and not place to put luggage. Breakfast...oh please nasty. You would do much better staying at the Hotel Amedeaus close to the train station...for better service, accomendations, and food. The only positive thing about this hotel is it's location to San Marcos.

Reviews.Title: “good location, only 3 star room at best”
Reviews.Author: luuvtotravel
Reviews.Content: Great location next to everything you need to see in Venice. Breakfast was excellent, which besides location, is the best thing about the hotel. I am not sure how it compares to other hotels in Venice, but the room was not good...the room is comparable to the Red Roof Inn or Motel 6 in the states...so if you are not from Europe, I would advise against booking a standard double room at this hotel, you will be disappointed for the price you pay. On a positive note, the hotel looks nice from the exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room we've ever been allocated in 24 years of extensive travel!”
Reviews.Author: HoberieAberdeenshire
Reviews.Content: Take care when booking. Bonvecchiati Palace is the refurbished and more elegant destination. We booked a standard double in the Bonvecchiati. Given that this hotel is rated as 4 star, we were unprepared for the state of our room. (See photos!) The bed was also in a poor state, the "roll together" meaning that you had to cling to the edge of the bed! If you can afford it book an upgraded room of some sort. The staff however could not be faulted and appeared to be embarrassed by the fact that we'd been allocated such a room, agreeing that in no way did it resemble the lovely internet photos. We were moved to another room (but not an upgrade) the following day, which was better, but not what we'd consider to be 4 star! As you can imagine, this spoiled the start of our already short weekend break. The location is ideal, but the hotel is very difficult to find. (The hotel location plan we printed was pretty unhelpful.) If you pass the Hard Rock cafe, you're pretty close. You should be able to walk to the hotel in around 5 minutes from either Rialto or San Marco, but the narrow streets create a real maze (which is lovely when you have time to wander, but tiresome when you're trying to find the hotel late at night dragging suitcases)! We took the Alilaguna ferry from the airport to Rialto - costs 13 euros each. Easy way to travel back and forth from the airport and much cheaper than a water taxi. Venice is beautiful arriving by boat at night. A trip to Murano is worthwhile - 6.50 euros each. If you accept a "free trip" with one of the factory touts be prepared for a hard sell after the obligatory visit to the glass blowing factory. The glass is beautiful but way out with our price range! 10 000 euros for a modest sized vase! We booked tickets to the opera which we thoroughly enjoyed (although we're not opera buffs) at 35 euros each for an abridged concerto performance. The singers and the orchestra were excellent and only a few minutes walk from the hotel. There are hotel singers called Mario and Sonia who perform Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. They are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, But!”
Reviews.Author: georgieboy63
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service and good sized room. Everything in good working order. Staff could not be more friendly. Breakfast choice excellent. But please Venice get your act together. We want tea making facilities in our rooms. If you want an international clientel then cater for them. An half board option would also go down well. You should not have to drag a kettle half way round the world in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doodlepidge
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were upgraded to a deluxe room in the annexe about 50 yards down the canal. The upside was that we had a corner room with views of the gondoliers parking bay and plenty of entertainment from the window. The downside was that we got very wet one morning during a storm on our way to breakfast. The room was large, lovely bathroom, comfortable bed, plenty of storage space. Breakfast was average for a European hotel - the cooked bacon & scrambled eggs were not very edible but the rest was very good. This hotel is billed as being by Rialto as this is the best stop on the waterbus from the airport or railway station, but it is actually closer to St Marks Square. We were able to walk everywhere and saved money on transport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded by Citalia to a Superior Room with a Canal View. The Canal View was a minor canal but it was lovely to see the gondaliers going by, when we were in the room. The room was the size that they stated on their web site, so size was ok but Room 227 was worn and shabby. The writing table was badly chipped. However, we could not fault the Staff at the Reception and the Restaurant. We did not eat there too expensive but they provided us with hot water and milk every evening as my husband only drinks decaffeinated tea. Breakfast was very good and from another review I learnt to always order cappucinno from the waitress,as the coffee on the breakfast table was not nice. We travelled by a budget airline into Treviso Airport and there is a brilliant coach service to Venice Bus Station Pizzale Roma at a cost of 9 euros return and then we took the waterbus to Hotel. We would never use a water taxi they are too much money. If mobility is an issue then the waterbus tickets that can be purchased for longer times are very good. You can use them to other places including islands. Something that I wish had been on the site, near the Boat Stations at Pizzale Roma (No 42) is a Co-op. We collected our bottles of water when we were down there and got biscuits to take home as gifts. Buy pasta at Treviso Airport when leaving so much cheaper. We do not believe that this Hotel should have a 4Star rating. However, the maid and porter service was excellent. The toiletries supplied, bathrobes, slippers etc were what we would have expected of 4 Star and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddy1mac
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this hotel is superb only 2 mins walk from St Marks Square and 5 mins walk to Rialto Bridge the hotel rooms need a major refurbishment which probably hasnt happened since the 1970s. On a more positive note the breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok, but worn down, and they tried to charge us for damages we didn't cause”
Reviews.Author: helbell52
Reviews.Content: The lobby and restaurant were nice, but the room was quite old and out-dated, and very small. The staff was a mixed bag, the reception staff were very helpful, but the restaurant staff were quite rude. I would not recommend this hotel though, because after we left, they charged us for breaking a mirror in the room. There was a crack in the mirror which was definitely there when we arrived, and they charged us 70 euros for it. They charged us without even sending an email to let us know why. When I tried reason with management, they insisted that we must have caused the damage without realising it (how you could cause a mirror to crack without realising it is beyond me). I would certainly not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing - a complete let down”
Reviews.Author: MRMLondon
Reviews.Content: Whilst the location of this hotel is fantastic, right between the Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Square, that just doesn't justify the exorbitant price. â‚¬400 a night when there is no way we should have been paying anymore than â‚¬100 for it in any other city. Hoping for a really special hotel (with planned proposal in mind), hugely disappointed by the service and, in particular, the room. Despite paying for the upgrade, we were put in probably the smallest (and darkest) double bedroom I have ever seen - when queried at the front desk, they argued that it was a "superior" room because the window overlooked the back of a canal. Whilst they did change us for the 2nd night into a bigger and brighter room, the damage had already been done.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel in Great Location with Small Clean Rooms: Value”
Reviews.Author: Great_Expectations84
Reviews.Content: We recommend booking the private water taxi transfers from VCE airport. The location of the hotel was great, we were able to walk to all major attractions. VClean rooms and bathrooms were small but efficiently laid out. The high ceilings also help to make it seem more spacious and airy. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Front desk staff was rude when the room was not ready. Breakfast was OK but the cappuccino was great! The sister hotel is the Bonvecchiati Palace is in the same great location but much more contemporary (and expensive).

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but had advantages”
Reviews.Author: New Orleans gal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by our cruise line - Holland America. The location was just wonderful, close to shopping, all Venice highlights. They had a nice buffet breakfast and the staff was really excellent - especially the front desk. Our room was large and bath was especially nice with marble double sink vanity, tub with shower, etc. The lobby was lovely, but furniture in the rooms was "somewhat tired". However the room was quite large with a kingsized bed. Although there was airconditioning, we didn't need it as it was cool during our stay - slept with the windows open and fell asleep to the wonderful sounds of Italy. The price was too high -but we were told to expect this for a great location in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 Star Hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: annietue
Reviews.Content: Super central, between St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. Beds were very comfortable, never slept so good. Breakfast was normal hotel standard, coffee not so good. Friendly staff at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Petru55
Reviews.Content: It was secont trip to Venice. We change the reservations for this hotel in the very last minute. And we did a GREAT JOB. It is in the heart of Venice. It is very clean and has a friendly staff. The breakfast was good. I will return for sure !

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nomanslander
Reviews.Content: Oh we loved it ! From the ideal location right next to a gondola park, less than 5mn from San Marco, to the beautiful elegant bedroom with views over a tiny canal and the constant feeling of being pampered, we enjoyed everything about our stay. Staff â€“ as almost everyone in Venice â€“ was extremely nice and obvioulsy loved their city (but who wouldnâ€™t), helping us to make the best of our stay by providing Â« secret Â» shortcuts and addresses. We attended concerts every night and they recommanded us the very few places available for late supper (since Venetians are pretty early birds). We had never found them by ourselves. Breakfast room, although large, seemed to be always full and busy and the staff seemed pretty overwhelmed. Breakfast â€“ and coffee !- were excellent. Only down side was the rotating entrance door that never seemed to be fully closed and as a result, the lobby was freezing cold and windy. Despite the fact Venice is one of the most visited town in the world, Venetians remain incredibly friendly and charming, and as tourists, we never ever fellt ripped off nor laughed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very very noisy”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we found it as part of a good deal(air+hotel) through Delta vacations. As stated in prior reviews, the location, equidistant between Rialto and San Marco, is perfect. That is the best feature of the hotel. Pro's: * front desk staff speaks excellent English, as well as many other languages *included breakfast is bountiful, although doesn't include many Italian offerings *Room and marble bathroom was spotless *bathrobe large + luxurious *local +800 calls free from room Con's: * Noise, noise, noise. Noise from the street, the hallways, stairwells. Shouting, fighting people in the street at 3:00am, shouting people in the hallways at 8:00am *No coffee/tea facilities in room *Towels very thin (though large) *Internet 6Euros/hour in lobby *carpets, rugs wearing thin, shabby *tiny elevators

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Ara1e
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Knowing Venice, I must say I didn't expect much of Bonvecchiati. Actually, it was really nice! Good points were: 1. people were really nice (our room was ready when arriving well before 2 pm, the very first day they knew who we were when coming back in the evening, when it rained they offered us an umbrella) 2. it is very well located in sestieri San Marco (5 minutes walking from Piazza San Marco, and when I say 5 minutes I mean you can leave piazza San Marco, walk calmly, take pictures of a couple of bridges and look at the gondolieri talking while waiting for tourists and even doing all that it will take you 5 minutes to get to Bonvecchiati!!), 3. there is a porta d'acqua (so you can ask the reception to send you a gondola to pick you there!!) 4. of course the room was small, but charming, with a nice bathtub (including two showerheads, great for sharing your shower and not getting cold!!) and powerful heating. 5. the hotel provides turndown service, and they deal not only with the bed, but also with the lights and shutters 6. their all-you-can-eat breakfast has the same standard quality as many other **** hotels in Italy: scramble eggs, sausages, bacon, ham, mortadela, salami, white bread, croissants and pains au chocolats, emmental, mozzarella, fruits, juices (including fresh orange juice, too sweet in my opinion), jam & butter, several kinds of Italian cakes and great capuccinos! Bad points are: 1. small room (though big enough for Venice) 2. their all-you-can-eat breakfast, for I would have appreciated more Italian products and not just some mortadella and mozarella, and, why not, more bread. Globally, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wbr4368
Reviews.Content: Pictures do way more justice than the rooms deserve. Our first room was tiny. So small the one medium case and 2 carry-ons took up all walking space in the room. There was no place in the bathroom to put a razor or tooth brush or anything so those items had to be placed on the bed. The shower had a fixed shower head that had virtually zero water pressure. It took 5 minutes to get warm water and that was gone in another 5 minutes. Even with the low water pressure the shower only had a curtain that loosely surrounded it so water flooded the entire bathroom. Transferred to a second room. Better size with a bath and much more room. Same low to no water pressure and this shower head was broke in 3 places so the water that did come out, actually flowed more like a water hose than a shower head. No internet service in this room. The staff said I could go back to the tiny room with internet or transfer to another room in their sister hotel about 30 meters away with no internet. The room and shower were nice and we took it but no internet service disrupted our entire plans since both my wife and my businesses are internet based. The staff was very nice on the outside but so not helpful understanding that this is not the way a 4 star hotel is run. We were there for 5 days and on the last two days we had friends from the UK join us. They transferred to new room immediately because of the size of their room and bathroom. I would never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone. The sister hotel was fine comfortable and a nice stay as long as you do not need internet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Stresa
Reviews.Content: The hotel Bonvecchiati is in a super location just a few minutes away from both Rialto and St. Mark's Square. I had a beautiful room on the top floor of the hotel. Newly decorated in a modern-chic style I was very impressed. I even had a view of the top of the Campanile and the Basilica. The room was very comfortable with a beautiful marble bathroom - I particularly liked the oversize bathrobe and slippers. The only draw back about the room was that it was overlooking (4 floors below) a loading/unloading platform where the garbage men come and collect the rubbish from, the delivery guys also. It seemed to me that they started working about 5am - it woke me up and kept me awake from there on! Maybe I am a light sleeper. The breakfast was very good. A great buffet selection of hot and cold foods. The coffee was terrible - it tasted to me like caffÃ¨ d'orzo and had a burnt taste to it. The breakfast was from 07.30 until 10.30 which is great - most people get up early in a city but it is also nice to have breakfast available until 10.30. The staff were very nice and friendly. Top marks. I have no problems in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just about the worst hotel experience I've had for years”
Reviews.Author: NorthernView
Reviews.Content: Sadly, there is only one good point I can think of for this hotel, the location. Great central location right in Venice only a short walk from St. Marks Square. But that's about it I'm afraid.... Uninspiring first impression & entrance, probably the shabbiest grottiest room I've seen in a long time....first room had virtually no daylight, changed to another, still had peeling paint, damp patches, basic metal beds, tiny basic & very dated shower room. Apparantly this was a standard room, not sure how much better the other rooms will be. Never the less, it is behond comprehension how an hotel with such a poor standard of rooms & facilities could be classified as 4 star. I really wouldn't bother staying here. Next time I would rather pay more and stay somewhere decent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, couldn't ask for a better choice”
Reviews.Author: ibogomolny
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit Venice for our 25th wedding anniversary, and to really enjoy it we decided to take a hotel in the city itself. The hotel had mixed reviews so we were not sure we will like it - but it was absolutely perfect. Here is why: * The location is fantastic, right between the Realto bridge and the San Marco square, 5 minutes waking from each. This means you can get on foot to every part of the city. * The double room that we got was small, mostly occupied by the double bed (a very good mattress) - but it was very well planned and very clean. There were plenty of hangers of all kinds in the closet, full length mirror on the bathroom door, a safe and well stocked minibar, all electric switches within easy reach, plenty of light in the room and bathroom if you wanted it, several easy to locate sockets to charge the phone and camera (without a need to move anything), a good bath, scales, magnifying mirror, bathrobes and slippers - all the stuff you want to feel pampered. Airconditioning was set to 24C but perfectly adequate to the size of the room and the season. * The stuff was very helpful and attentive * The breakfast was OK - good selection of cheeses, salamis and fruit, and passable pastries. Ask for cappuchino or espresso, not the standard coffee pot - they are much better. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant in the evening - the menu is pricey but not exeptianlly so, compared to other places we saw, but I cannot say anything about food itself. There is live music in the evening. * There is even access to fitness center in the sister Palace hotel around the corner. Other tips: If you want to do any dry-cleaning - it is not possible on the weekend. Also, the hotel provides you a free boat and guide to a glass factory in Murano. The selection there is very big and you get to see a wine glass made, but the initial prices are outrageous. If you plan on buying anything, check out the price of similar items in the shops, take 20% off (at least) and bargain down to that - they want to sell and are willing to take at least 60 to 70% off the original asking price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Zaskerboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at Bonvecchiati. We were in a room not attached to the main hotel building. It was very clean and well furnished, quite modern with tall windows on two sides of the room which looked out over the canal and small gondola lagoon below. Staff very helpful and curtious, breakfast buffet well stocked and to a high standard. Hotel idealy located, 1 minute walk and you are in St Mark's square. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very nice outside patio/restuarant... very small room and canal view overlooked trash dump”
Reviews.Author: jpsegrave
Reviews.Content: Very clean, very nice outside patio/restuarant, great staff........ very small room and canal view (from room, not from rest.) overlooked trash dump. I would stay here again because it is nice and has a great location, but I would not pay extra for an upgraded room. From what I could tell this was the only part of the canal that hotel has to overlook. Also, for 500 a night internet access should be included. Breakfast was great (best we had anywhere in Italy) but the dinner was not great and was certainly not worth the prices..... but they did have the best house Chianti of all places we ate entire week!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant Hotel that made a brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: weluvlakegarda
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise, we booked this as a last minute deal and ended up in the annex opposite which looked newly refurbished- very chic. It is a brilliant hotel, and the staff were great, making a fuss of us because we were celebrating 25 years marriage, it made the trip truly memorable. The restaurant was a bit pricey, but it was top quality, and the position 2 mins from St Marks Sq couldn't be better. I'm just not sure what the Americans who rate this low are seeing - this is a clean quality hotel, and the staff give great service. I'm going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: tinatot76
Reviews.Content: It was our first time to Italy, first stop Venice. We didnâ€™t know what to expect, well we werenâ€™t disappointed. Our friends honeymooned at this hotel so we figured we would try it. The hotel is lovely; easy to get to once you are on the island. It is a 2 min walk to the square and a 5 min walk to the Grand Canal. We had breakfast included in our room rate and it was one of the best included meal we have ever had on any of our European vacations. The staff was helpful. Highly recommend this hotel, should we ever be in Venice again there is no doubt we will stay here again. We had a descent sized room, even for European standards, with a closet, located on the inside canal, with a view of the city line.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruiky
Reviews.Content: I was initially disappointed as when we arrive at 11:30pm we were told our room had been given to somebody else, but they had moved us to their sister hotel around the corner. The sister hotel was pleseant enough but nothing special. When we returned the next day we were upgraded to a junior suite for the rest of our stay. The room was excellent, kept spotlessly clean, and the staff were extremely helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again, but maybe ring ahead next time if I'll be arriving late.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place, would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Vauxhall27
Reviews.Content: After reading bad reviews on this hotel, I wanted to write one to say that after returning from a three day city break staying at the bonvecchiati I really liked it. Hotel is in a brilliant location. We paid for a superior room and upon arrival were given a deluxe, it was lovely. Very spacious, clean, bed was comfortable and bathroom was nice, i would recommend paying the bit extra as we had a balcony overlooking a canal which was very romantic and nice! Breakfast in the hotel was lovely every morning and the staff were all pleasant. The best thing about this hotel is location, value for money and cleanliness. I will be returning next summer to venice as it is one of the nicest places I have ever been and will be returning to the Bonvecchiati without a doubt. Dont listen to bad reviews as I had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel experience in an otherwise beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: skilltel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved Venice... the staff was unfriendly, the room was tiny despite our upgrade to a "deluxe room" (smaller than a room on a cruise ship), the air conditioning did not work properly, the bed was stiff, the bathroom was outdated and small, and the breakfast was horrible (bacon uncooked, watery eggs). The only positive we have with regards to the hotel is the location; but in Venice any hotel in San Marco is very convienient as we discovered as it is a relatively small area. Outside of the hotel we very much enjoyed the city, and would most definately return to Venice and spend the extra money for a better hotel to improve the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place/small room”
Reviews.Author: RHSRebel
