Reviews.Content: Great location near St. Mark's; staff was helpful and friendly; the breakfast was outstanding - easily the best of any we had in over three weeks of travel in Europe. Room was small but seems to be the nature of moderately priced hotels in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want to keep your sanity”
Reviews.Author: gsloman
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness we only booked for 3 nights - for a 'deluxe double' we were given a pokey little room which had nothing deluxe about it, it didn't even have a mirror in it and the shower was a dribble of water! But worst was the same as a previous reviewer: we were at the back of the hotel backing onto a canal but it was impossible to sleep after 6.30am because the barges were loading/unloading anything from garbage to hotel towels - it was like having a motorbike constantly revving its engine outside our window - and since half the rooms are at the back of the hotel the chances are you will experience the same if you stay here. My advice .... avoid like the plague ... there are much better, cheaper hotels with much friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aicram69
Reviews.Content: It's a pity that you travel such a long way just be disgusted with disappointing service and dingy walls in the bedroom. Apart from the breakfast service where, the young waitresses really tried their best to offer some service; the overall service was appalling!!!! Especially based on how expensive the rooms were. We stayed 4 nights and on the 3rd night our hotel room was not even cleaned yet (around 4 pm). We just decided to have a nap on the bed because it was extremely warm in Venice. The cleaning lady came around 4:30 and i turned her away! Really, at that point, my tolerance was at the lowest point ever. Also, the concierge staff are so unfriendly, in particular the men, I was so disappointed in the way they handled issues - it is almost like they did not want to be bothered! Anyway, the only thing i can say is Once is Definitely Enough - Never Again!!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: whittisteve
Reviews.Content: Well, I hunted around for bargains in Venice and couldn't really find any, this wasn;t the moast expensive and certainly wan't cheap, but it is a nice, friendly decent hotel in a brilliant location. Clean and tidy, room size was OK compared to other european cities and I thought the breakfast was great with plenty of choice. The location is the winner for me, just behind St. Marks and only a short walk from Rialto. You are never far from the hotel should you need a rest from all the walking. The aircon was a bit noisy - but very effective. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSailors
Reviews.Content: We always read tripadvisor reviews, so when those and a friend recommended the hotel, we selected it for our home in Venice. Our first room was located right next to the corner where the garbage boats pick up trash and transport boats unload. It started at 6 a.m. and went on for 3 hours. We got moved to an extremely small and dingy room. While the location is good and the breakfast is good, the experience was disappointing for the amount paid.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller_Mia
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a really really great location. I was 1 miunte away from Hard Rock caffe (just around the corner), 4 mintes walk to St marco square, Armai is just around the corner too. It was very comfortable, clean the the breakfast was good too. The staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in an Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: SMMSBR
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable! It is between San Marco and Rialto Bridge, which means one can walk around Venice and go back to the hotel for a quick rest at anytime. The hotel is also close to brand-name stores for those interested in shopping. However, the proximity to major sites also mean that the noises on the street can be heard in the rooms. I was waken up several times one morning because of all the noises from the street and inside the hotel. I consider my room to be basic. Unfortunately, unlike those of previous reviewers who had posted pictures here, my bathroom had not been updated. As a result, Bonvecchiati felt more like a 3-star hotel. Perhaps because the food in most places in the touristy Venice was horrible and unjustifiably expensive, the breakfast buffet included in the room rates at Bonvecchiati stood out. The freshly brewed coffee was delicious! The restaurant staff were also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: RCH3
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, right on one of the smaller canals. Very short walk (5 min) to San Marco Sq. Staff were very friendly and helplful (and spoke good English). Room was nice. Breakfast buffet was free and really very good. Only complaint would have been the noise in the streets could be heard in the room, but I would suspect this is not a problem unique to this hotel. I stayed with my wife and 2-year-old daughter. Hotel was child-friendly and set up an extra bed for my daughter. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Dondea
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great. It's pretty much halfway between St Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge. It's near some lovely little family-owned restaurants and ice-cream parlours too that won't charge you the earth! We went for the Superior double room which was very clean and big. The buffet breakfast wasn't bad either. I recommend the bite-size pain-au-choclat. Oh, and if you ask for tea don't forget to ask for milk too. The hotel has it's own docking area for water taxis so if you fancy hiring a taxi it's great. There's a big Gondola bay right next to it too where you can find at least 20 gondolas waiting.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: laidbackhappy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights feb/march, weekend break. Hotel is easy to find coming from waterbus stop at St Marks Sq. Room was 416 on the sixth(?) floor & was generously proportioned for an italian hotel. Bright & airy with calming neutral colours. Bathroom was top notch also. The staff were charming & helpful. The breakfast was great & set us up well for the day. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We booked a deluxe room on hotels.com for â‚¬400 incl taxes for the 3 nights, which I would consider great value for Venice, so I can't comment on what the standard rooms are like

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But A Bit Expensive”
Reviews.Author: laexodus
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be quite nice, and not too difficult to find (after first going to the nearby Palace Bonvecchiati, which is same chain but different hotel). We didn't book for a canal view room, but received a top floor suite with serenading gondoliers sailing by. It appears based on other reviews that some rooms are rather small, but our room was quite large and had a large modern bathroom. It was a bit pricey at about $350/night, but this is Venice. Great location, very short walk to the St. Mark's one direction or a very short walk to the Rialto Bridge in the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; no problems”
Reviews.Author: lrm20
Reviews.Content: We visited Venice in early December 2008 for the weekend- our first visit. The hotel wasn't too hard to find (for Venice - where everything is a little hard to find) and really well located, about halfway between St Marks Square and the Rialto bridge. The hotel staff were helpful, and had no problems with our late check-in. Our standard double room was very small, but well appointed and comfortable, and the rate was reasonable (although it was December). Breakfast was a good buffet selection (although you had to work pretty hard to get someone to serve you coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: jewel100
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 3 nts at the Bonvechiatti. We were leading a group of travel agents, sampling the products we were selling! In total we saw 20 hotels, ranging from 3* to 5* Deluxe, but I really loved this hotel. The rooms were SO clean, the buffet breakfast was as good as you would expect in the US (only healthier!), and we had an evening meal which was the best we sampled during our visit. Be careful with the hotel breakfasts, most do not offer this type, many just offer crossiants and coffee/tea, anything else is additional in cost. I've seen some comments regarding 'tired' rooms and 'coffin like' lifts, but if you so some research you will understand that these are actually very old buildings that weren't built as hotels originally! The lifts are fine, not really a deal breaker if a little cramped! Not sure about the 'tired' rooms either, as most have been completely refurbished, and those that haven't are still ample and fresh compared to the majority of other 4* hotels here. I would definately recommend it, and I am a very choosy person!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Tiggey2
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Italy i did'nt know where the best places were to stay, I came across the Bonvecchaiti Hotel and liked the look of it. It was amazing the bedrooms were clean and modern, they came and turned down your bed on a night and left a light on for you and it was right off St Marks Square. A hotel for those looking for a romantic weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dagb20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Bonvecchiate Hotel in June for 3 nights. The rooms are basic enough, but the staff were helpful, breakfast was great and the location is ideal for Historic Venice - just 2 minutes from St. Marks square.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but, typical of Venice, overpriced and looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: sauceykat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my mom and sister (2 rooms). It was very expensive but a decent hotel for Venice (my 2nd trip in 1 year). The rooms superficially looked really nice however underneath the Venetian veneer of marble and murano glass chandeliers, there were a few problems. Mainly, the shower head in the bathroom didn't work, the tv's colour was off which made renting a movie impractical and the on-screen internet (which always froze after 1 minute) useless. The biggest drawback is the noise level, as my room was above the entrance to the hotel and it was very noisy at night with all the loud music rising up from the hotel's restaurant from 7pm-12am (you would think it would be kind of nice to hear the music, but...it's not). Staff were okay but several were a bit snooty and were not accomodating at all, especially front desk. They don't seem to be aware of services offered in their own guest book (nobody knew anything about room service, the hotel wouldn't provide stamps for postage despite the guest guide declaring that they will stamp your mail for you and charge your room, etc.). Food in the restaurant was okay (we ate there many times) but very overpriced, as I had expected. Lunch is okay but dinner and dessert is exorbitant. I ordered a small shot of Limoncello (costs 6 Euros for a 1L bottle on the street) and was charged 20 Euro! Also, they tried to charge us 750Euro on our last night for "mini bar" charges (which is impossible, even if we had emptied the minibar which we didn't) and the front desk guy tried to argue with me that it was "normal" and it was the room charge even though the room charge was listed below. After he counted and recounted the bill several times, he told me that his colleague would work it out in the morning in time for us to check out (which he did, fortunately). It could have been an honest mistake, however I noticed that several times in the 5 days I spent in Venice, waiters, shopkeepers, etc. tried to overbill us. Either their math skills are horrible or they're trying to pull one over on tourists. Having said all that, I do love Venice which is why this was my 2nd trip in 1 year. The hotel was okay but very noisy and overpriced and I would highly recommend a cheaper hotel. Also, typical for European hotels, the elevators were like coffins! I stayed at the Hotel Serenissima right around the corner last year and it was much cheaper and I think the rooms were nicer (and much quieter) but of course it had less amenities (i.e. no restaurant, no elevator). I would give Hotel Bonvecchiati a 5/10--perhaps I would raise it to a 6 just because of the included buffet breakfast which was quite nice (for Europe, anyways) and the general ambience of the lobby and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: salsapeach
Reviews.Content: First visit to Venice (and Italy) and stayed in the Bonvecchiati Hotel for two nights. Couldnt fault anything about it - the staff were very helpful, the room was lovely (maybe a little small) overlooking the gondolas on the canal below. The breakfast was very good and plenty of it. the hotel was very close to all the main St Marks Square and Rialto Bridge. The hotel was clean and efficiently run. We ate in the hotel one night and found it quite expensive but the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice breakfast, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: It's not easy to find hotels at the last minute for Venice in July. We booked the Bonvecchiati without any particular expectation of what it would be like. The location was good - 5 mins from Rialto or St Mark's Square. One of my boys didn't want to go in the lift - it was, as one reviewer said, 'coffin-like'. The hallway particularly on our floor (third) had a strange smell, which fortunately did not permeate into the rooms we booked. However, the rooms were tired with dirty looking carpets and worn bathroom fittings (lots of filler in the bath in a narrow bathroom - which had a shower but nowhere to attach the shower head to the wall). Our children's room was a good size, but ours was oddly small. The connection between rooms worked well with a small corridor to connect them. The view was of a small shopping street (ie nothing) but it was quiet. Breakfast was great, very big restaurant setting with a varied buffet. Kids loved that. The waitresses were very friendly and cleared used plates etc as we ate. Front desk staff not always amazingly useful at booking events or tours - acted like they would book something but seemed to give up on it and say they 'couldn't get through', but only if you went back to find out what they had done, and wouldn't necessarily offer an alternative. We only took a restaurant recommendation once from the hotel, for lunch. The place was nearby (Leon d'Oro) but the food was not appetising (soggy pizza, cold lasagne, a bit grubby in general). Shame really because the staff were kind and friendly. Not terrible overall, but hoped for something better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ketak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Bonvecchiati, and had booked a Double Deluxe Room at the price of 280 Euro, a year ago through Venere. To our delight, we had room 410 on the top floor (5th floor, go figure) which had 3 windows, a corner view and a view down to the canal by the restaurant. You could literally walk to the vaporettos in about 4 minutes and were a 3 minute pleasurable stroll to San Marco Square. The room was plenty big enough (see photos) and the bathroom was adorned with marble, robes and slippers and all the treats. We had lunch at the restaurant and the food was great, pricey but comparable, and decent service. Breakfast was included, and included hot options that were alright. The front desk staff are a little intimidating but helpful, and helped us with booking a reservation for dinner. We can't complain about this place (despite other travellers' reviews)...we did however book the higher level of accomodation, so I think that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Town”
Reviews.Author: KiraMexico
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific. 2 minute walk to San Marco and Rialto Bridge. Great value for money - we paid an average of $330 a night with breakfast, which was substantial. The staff is not very helpful, they sort of have an attitude. The rooms are on the small side but comfortable. The beds are very comfortable although small. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Service good, Rooms quite bad”
Reviews.Author: fly_one_oh_one
Reviews.Content: A shock when we walked into the room for the 1st tme. We stayed in a superior twin, overlooking the canal. The room was quite small, nothing like the pictures claimed. Also a little poorly decorated, hospital pink walls, small rugs and just lack of real quality. Bathroom however was nice as was the housekeeping, which kept the room feeling like we were getting a decent service for what we were paying. On the whole a dissapointing room, which offered a fine service. Take a look in a guide book before you go, and don't necesarily stay in San Marco (centre) as its packed with tourists, and its easy to walk from the other districts.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience & Appalling Service”
Reviews.Author: broadhorizons
Reviews.Content: I'd booked this "boutique" hotel for a surprise romantic weekend away with my boyfriend. We arrived a day late due to issues with flights leaving Heathrow the night before and with the airline, KLM, but I notified the hotel to inform them of this. On arrival at the hotel the next day we were shown to a dinghy, dark, substandard room right at the top and back of the hotel. I complained and said that this was not what I had booked: the staff were surly and slow to respond. When they did they showed us to a very cramped double room which was still poorer quality than I'd expected on booking, but they claimed that they didn't have any others available. The following morning we ordered breakfast on room service: it took them an hour to bring it up and when they did the food was cold and congealed. We'd already given up this hotel as a bad lot and decided that it wasn't such a problem as we had all of Venice to explore. I would NEVER recommend staying at this hotel. It's overpriced, offers appalling service, tries to palm off rooms that you'd see in a poor Indian hostel as one that it expects you to pay the going rate for a four star hotel and the overall service and attitude is dire. DON'T book it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkerSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Expedia who did not have any reviews on the site at that time. When we subsequently looked on Tripadvisor we were very concerned as the majority of the reviews were negative and many reviewed the Bonvecchiatti as awful. We decided that there was no going back and we just had to make the best of it. Great relief! The hotel was maybe 500m from St Marks Square but in a peaceful spot. The room (232) was immaculate and decorated to a very high standard, comfortable bed and plenty of space. Bathroom very smart and good shower. All the staff were very helpful and pleasant, the breakfast, on the terrace was a good continental breakfast with their version of bacon and eggs, very strong coffee and large choice. You can order other coffees and teas if you wish. If you leave the hotel in the opposite direction to St Marks you are at Rialto in 3 minutes walk with some surprisingly reasonable restaurants on the Grand Canal (lunch menu E14.50) Good hotel, well situated and a great base for walking the city. Downside- drinks at the bar are VERY expensive and canal can smell a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay. Charming & Central”
Reviews.Author: Natstar78
Reviews.Content: This is a great find for anyone seeking a centrally located Venetian hotel. Our room was modern, tastefully decorated & spacious for Venice standards. Loved the bathroom. You get what you pay for, so upgrade to the Superior or Deluxe room category. The staff were friendly & attentive. This was my 2nd visit to Venice. Last time I stayed at the Hotel Kette. Both are lovely, yet I do favour Hotel Bonvecchiati for it's space & modern feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break & good people.”
Reviews.Author: KSB-08
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice with my family earlier this week & was staying at a hotel at St. Marco Square. On one of our walks, we discovered Hotel Bonvecchiatti. We walked in, booked ourselves a room for 2 adults & 2 kids, moved out of our other hotel. To our surprise, the staff offered us two separate attached rooms instead of a junior suite. That was a very nice gesture. We were very comfortable. It;s centrally located, great access to a private taxi & gondolas. I would surely recommend this to anyone traveling to Venice. Great breakfast & super ambience. Very Venetian. I also saw their other property - the Palace Bonvecchiatti - very modern. We'll probably try that next trip. Very professional !! KB

Reviews.Title: “Economy room so small that there was no chair”
Reviews.Author: Marcia Mae
Reviews.Content: The Economy room was the smallest hotel room we have every stayed in! Could hardly get around the double bed, and no room for more than a bureau, 2 bedside tables, and closet. Room was clean. Bathroom had a fixed round shower head that ran either hot or cold. Shower was in the corner of floor with curtain. The people at the desk were very friendly. Asked to have our luggage put in luggage room but it stayed in the hall!! The big asset for the hotel is the easy distance to St. Mark's Square and gondolas. Breakfast is ample, and a good selection. Dinner in the dining room is about $100 for 2 pasta dinners with bread, and surly waiters. Eat elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Paying for Location...”
Reviews.Author: Chris_E_Dub
Reviews.Content: We booked a 'special' weekend away through the Ryanair website, paying some Â£200.00 (â‚¬240.00 / $400.00) per night for a three-night stay. The hotel was tricky to find, more down to the mad street layout of Venice than through the fault of the hotel. Best way to get there is to get the Vaporetto (we came from the bus station at Piazzale Roma) to San Marco. This drops you off right in front of Harry's Bar. From here walk straight up, do a left at the end, then immediately right. At the end of this lane duck right under the covered walkway which you brings you out at the 'basin' where people gather for the gondolas. Look left and you'll see the hotel right by the big Armani shop. As for the hotel itself... The staff seemed perfectly pleasant (we spoke not a work of Italian other than 'bongiorno' and 'grazie') and gave us a map of Venice, explaining our location. We ended up pretty much ingoing the map and just meandering, but it was a nice touch. The porter took our case and nigh-on sprinted up to our room. For the next day it took a while to remember the route he had taken, it was that quick. As other reviewers have noted, this place is right on the doorstep of San Marco and for that, is great. Don't be misled by that though! Venice is fairly easily navigable on foot and we realised that there was no reason to be too 'near' anything. Especially when paying such a premium. Our room (312) was tiny. I mean TINY. Some reviewers seem to have lucked out and had decently sized rooms, reflecting what can be seen on the hotel's website. We had no such luck. Having stayed in a few hotels around the world we would have been happy had we paid Â£60.00 for (â‚¬70.00 / $120.00) each night. We'd have reasoned "you get what you pay for". But this was ludicrous. There were no frills with the room. No drink-making facilities. Being 6' 1" I could not even lie in the bath without my knees bent up by my chest. We figured that it was just a place to get our head down and we could do without home comforts. However, upon our return home I came round and felt that we had been cheated. The price was extortionate for what we got, breakfast was mediocre with the worst coffee I have ever tasted (and good luck trying to get a second cup!). In short, if you are going to Venice, don't be swayed by location â€“ ensure you really are getting a decent room that suits your needs and pocket. I wonder if we'd have been allocated a better room had we booked direct, rather than through a no-frills airline?

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanne_8
Reviews.Content: We booked that hotel trough Ryan air web site and were delightfully happy with that choice of hotel. We were travelling two women friend. They provided us with a great room with two bedroom. It was off season so we just paid 100 euro for that room that is situated about 5 mins walk from place St-Mark. The bathroom was modern and clean, and the room were like the building, With character and well maintain. The breakfast was included in the price and we took it in a very spacious dining room. There was a great variety of food, juices and cofee. I would definitively recommend that hotel to anybody that goes in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a 4 Star - Not Worth the Expense”
Reviews.Author: 2xNZTravellers
Reviews.Content: We had the displeasure and frustration of staying at this tired, run down hotel. We had booked a 4* hotel as a treat. I can honestly say the well located 2* hotels in Rome, Paris, Copenhagen, Amsterdam (none of which are cheap places to stay) beat this hotel 300%. We felt completely & totally ripped off. The 1st room was very hot the heating couldn't be adjusted we opened the window but a fire escape staircase blocked the way & was a security risk. We tried the aircon only to be told it doesn't work in March. With no chance of sleeping they begrudgingly moved us. The 2nd room was worse, it was cooler, because the heating didn't work at all! The room was tiny no room to even put your bag down. To get past the tiny uncomfortable bed you had to sidestep to avoid the window handle. The walls were paper thin you could hear every word from the neighbours. The door was ill fitting, you could see the ancient lock mechanism, the noise from the hallway was slightly blocked out by the people on the street and an ATM machine directly below the window. The bathroom was awful, cracked tiles, nowhere to put your things, the showerhead came out over the floor & was not adjustable (it was clean). Breakfast was ok, coffee was vile, staff were unfriendly. Stay somewhere else! Stay close to a Vaporetto stop as carrying bags through the crowds & over bridges gets very tedious very fast.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: bezzaEngland
Reviews.Content: just came back from a weekend here.what can i say.its perfect.great location great staff,and a beautiful restaurant.i would reccomend this hotel to anyone and iam very fussy.not sure why it has come down so low on the list.we had a brand new room though but i know the whole hotel is havin a refit.we went to the grand canal restaurant at hotel monaco .fabulous worth every penny and the best meal we had by far.was expensive but then what isnt in venice.word of warning do not go to do forni worst meal of my life i refused to pay.dont waste money on water taxis the waterbus is so easy to use and a third of the cost.oh and harrys bar what is all the fuss about.just a very overpriced bar.beautiful city though and well worth a vist.im sure it would be even more stunning in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Feffe
Reviews.Content: We had one day and night in Venice after coming down from a week of skiing in Cortina before we flew back to Sweden. We had booked the Albergo Bonvecchiati on the web, got a double room for about 200 Euro. I was a bit nervous since italian hotel style and standards seldom meet up to that of northern part of Europe. However, I was surprised by the rooms, we stayed on the sixt floor in what felt like a completely new room. Very nice with a huge bathroom and a small tub. Lots of goodies such as robes, slippers, and other stuff. Lovely beds. The maid came in when we were out eating to make up the bed for the night and close the shutters, good service. Breakfast OK. Location wonderful. I recommend to walk a few blocks to Palace Bonvecchiati where a really nice restaurant is located nearby the hotel, it's called Bistrot de Venise Ristorante Bar & Enoteca (Michelin rated). We had a lovely dinner there for 140 euros for two people so I don't understand previous comments about 100 Euros per person. Otherwise I would recommend to leave the busy tourist parts around San Marco square and walk over Ponte Rialto into the more calm north side of Grand Canal. Walkning down to Academia Bridge you'll pass a couple of really nice looking smaller restaurants in the alleyways. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Fantastic Location.”
Reviews.Author: kurtz800
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com and got an excellent price. The hotel website stated double rooms were 160 euros (Â£120) a night, lastminute.com got my mother and I two single rooms with double beds for three nights including BA flights from London for Â£530 all in for both of us. I found this an excellent hotel, the staff were polite and helpful, the breakfast buffet was extensive and of high quality, though the scrambled eggs were odd. The hotel restaurant was very good, but you would do much better to eat out as other places offer more traditional venetian fare. I have no idea why CandSF so hated this hotel perhaps their just idiots. Our rooms were small but perfect, the bathroom worked well, the goodies were great, the shower worked as it should and gave a good pressure, the bed was comfortable and the sheets were changed daily. The location of the hotel was stunning - a three minute walk to San Marco Square and seven or so to the Rialto Bridge. The rooms were small but then so is Venice. My mother and I got up at eight each day and met for breakfast, left the hotel at nine to explore, returned at about four and left again at six'ish and returned at nine or so. What on earth you need a bigger room for I have no idea. I would happily return to this hotel and venice and equally happily recommend this hotel to a friend. Michael Windsor

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant trip!”
Reviews.Author: pharmcat
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at the Bonvecchiati for our silver wedding anniversary. It turned out to be the most relaxing and enjoyable holiday we have had for a long time! I wonder what the previous reviewers may have done to upset the staff, as we found them all unfailingly polite and helpful. After a delay at the airport (BA had managed to split my suitcase) we took a water taxi to the hotel, but could not be dropped at the hotel door. This was a bit unfortunate, as it meant I had to carry my case through the streets, but nothing insurmountable. On arrival at the hotel, within 10 minutes we were booked in, the bellboy had taped up my case, carried it to my room and untaped it so I could unpack. The room was small but clean, and had everything I would have expected, from toiletries to fluffy dressing gowns and slippers. Our room was dual aspect, and the occasional gondolier singing under the window enlivened our evenings! The location of the hotel is superb, a couple of minutes' walk from St Mark's - most evenings we wandered back to the square around 11pm to soak up the atmosphere and watch the moon rising over the Basilica. I have a feeling that in the summer Venice must be unbearable, and I suspect I may have found the volume of tourists oppressive. However, in November it was perfect - no queues, no waiting, no jostling. Brilliant! Breakfast in the hotel is buffet style, but with enough food out that you had no real need to eat again until dinner time (which is probably a blessing, with the prices in Venice!). The room was cleaned regularly, in fact every time we left the room the maid popped in to fluff up the pillows and straighten the sheets! At one point I completely mucked up the lock on the room safe (although it turned out it wasn't my fault, the batteries had gone flat!), the concierge immediately came to have a look, and within 5 minutes the handyman had it sorted. The small bar off the foyer is not staffed most of the time, but we simply asked at reception and someone would come and serve us drinks and free nibbles. The only slight criticism I have is that the service was a little slow when we had an evening meal in the hotel restaurant, but as we were in no hurry, it didn't matter. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and as long as visitors remember that a hotel such as this is placed centrally in a packed city, so you are unlikely to get a palazzo at this price, I would have no hesitation in going back.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Colin_B58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel at the last minute, after other travel plans failed, and didn't we land on our feet. The hotel is perfectly situated about 200 m behind Piazza San Marco, the facade looked elegant and well maintained, unlike many of the buildings you will pass on your way to the hotel either from The Piazza or Rialto! The interior decore is elegant and stylish. On our arrival we found the reception staff professional and friendly, after registering we had a short wait for the "bell boy" to take our luggage to our room. The room we had was well decorated and clean, had ample wardrobe/storage space, there was also a safe and mini bar (For those interested, the satellite TV consisted of 9 free channels; 6 Italian, 1 French, 1 German and CNN for English speakers). Unlike many of the photos of the rooms on the web site, do not be surprised if your bedroom is no larger than 10'x10' (3mx3m) with a small wc/shower room adjacent, once again beautiful decorated in green marble. Our room was on the 3rd floor, above the street, however we had no excessive noise and with the windows open you could hear the peeling of bells from Piazza San Marco, on the hour and half hour. The breakfast room was well staffed with a abundance of young waitresses; there is a wide choice of produce in the buffett, something for every palate. We stayed for 4 nights; fresh sheets, towels and toilettries were supplied each day. For all the room was a little small everything else was very good. Some additional info:- Vaparetto from the Airport - San Marco = Euro 12, (75-90 min). Vaparetto, various routes = Euro 6.50 (single journey), however Venice is so compact you can and should walk everywhere. If you want to get over the Grand Canal, but you are not near one of the 3 bridges, why not try the Gondola Crossing points which there are a few and will be marked on your map issued by reception, the trip costs 40c, however the voyage is priceless. This mode of transport seemed to be mostly used by locals, however you can tell the tourist, the're the ones sitting down!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CandSF
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the room - the noise from the street was invasive - when we were moved to another room (after complainning) building/refurbishment work in the corridor outside our door, woke us at 8:00am - there was no apology for this from the staff (or prior warning) - advertised as a Four Star - but inferior to many Three Stars we have stayed in - only redeeming feature was breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elpeniki
Reviews.Content: Had to write a review for our stay here. It was just perfect! Bellisimo! We had a deluxe room on the corner with a view of the canal........ it was worth every dollar! Venice was our favorite city & this room & hotel was partially the reason. Food was excellent. The room was as clean as could be & decorated in the Art Deco style. Very tastefully done with marble bath & an incredible glass folding round shower door within the tub! Just amazing........ The linens were exactly as you've read about for Italy, very sumptuous & wonderful. I'm still dreaming of them! The breakfast was included & was great! Anything you might want was available. The Cappachino & the buffet was yummy! The staff was very helpful & the location was the best! We were able to walk to St Mark's & the Rialto in minutes. We also got LOST in Venice, but then doesn't everyone? I can't say enough about this hotel. We will stay here again if & when we return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “The Honey and the Moon”
Reviews.Author: bristoljen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Bonvechiatti three years ago and decided to come back for our honeymoon as we loved it so much. Then I realised that I had booked the Hotel Bonvechiatti on lastminute.com - the wrong hotel!!! I was so upset especially when I read the reviews on here. I emailed the hotel manager to ask if we could have a very nice room as it was our honeymoon. I was so worried after seeing the pictures of the hotel on here. Our room was on the top floor of the hotel and had a dual aspect overlooking one two of the main canals and one of the main streets leading to St Marks Square. It was wonderful to open the shutters on our hotel room and hear all the gondalas and delivery boats going past in the morning. The room was newly refurbished and full of designers italian leather furniture with a brand new modern bathroom, just like the palace bonvechiatti has. The location is very central, right in between St Marks and Rialto Bridge and ideal for a very special stay. The staff very very friendly, unlike the descriptions in the reviews here. We found a fab waiter at breakfast who was half italian half english who recommended a nice restaurant that the locals go to. This saved our holiday as the restaurants in Venice are vile, very over priced. I bought a guide book to the restaurants of venice half way through the honeymoon which tells you the restaurants the locals go to as we were having massive problems finding nice places to eat that didnt charge 100 Euros a head. We had internet in our room which was cheap to use. This was useful when our bank cancelled our bank cards becuase we tried to take cash out in Venice!!! The hotel tidied our room twice a day and made the bed. I had to keep stealing toothpaste from the maids trolley as they dont keep the bathroom supplies topped up but other than that great. The lifts are indeed tiny, just enough room for two so I can imagine this could get pretty annoying in summer but there is a perfectly good staircase next to them so I suggest all those moaning yanks stop being lazy and walk if they dont fit in the lift! Overall the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sweetbabes
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice with a group of friends and had the most amazing time, I did'nt think that i would be so moved by such a beautiful place. We stayed in the bonvecchiati for 2 nights (fri-sat), i would recommend a private water taxi to your hotel. We passed many people pulling their luggage behind them trying to find their hotels around venice!!! Are taxi pulled up outside the "back door" on the canal, it was fab, we handed our luggage to the porters and jumped across into the hotel. We were quickly shown to our rooms, are room was ok (317), although it did have a big stain on the carpet, looked like coffee. Not great i suppose but the beds were very comfortable and bedding was very crisp and clean. Bit dated but again the bathroom was clean and the hotel provided towels, bath robes, slippers, toothbrush, shower gel, shampoo, sewing kit, tissues, hair dryer and a few other little things in the bathroom. Breakfast was very good and yummy, a wonderful selection to tempt all. We booked a private taxi back to the airport through the hotel, not sure if they charge per person or it is a standard rate, but anyway the total was 120 euros. The Bonvecchiati is sooooooo central, we could of not got any closer to st marks square, you walk out the front of the hotel...straight ahead.......turn left.....turn right and their you have the most wonderful place on earth. I would recommend this hotel, but i am not likely to ever visit venice again as this is a place that just hits you and fills you with the most amazing feelings of joy, dumb struck, tearful because of its beauty, amazement and i would never get those feelings again, i want to hold onto them forever.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great!”
Reviews.Author: enihous
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near St-Mark's place but the room we stayed in had three windows and absolutely no view. There was absolutely no point in opening the windows. Also the staff at the front desk is quite aloof. There is none of the warmth you might expect from an Italian hotel. The breakfast in quite disappointing. Terrible scrambled eggs and orange juice, awful breads and jams... To make it worse my husband forgot his cell phone charger in the room, just by the bed. We realized it about three hours after we checked out. I called the hotel and beofre they would even look for it they said they'd need my credit card number in order to mail me the charger (we are talking about mailing from Italy to France!) I think that after charging us over â‚¬400 a night the hotel could afford to send a charger free of charge! In any case they were unhelpful and claimed that they did not find the charger. Someone must have found and either kept it or ditched it! Bad service for a four star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: chriswestport
Reviews.Content: Myself and five friends visited Venice for the first time and booked this Hotel as it looked very nice on the web site and had a great location. The location is great for someone visiting Venice for the first time, but we were very disappointed with the Hotel. This is classed as a four star Hotel, but we felt it definately was rated wrongly. We booked two triple rooms, we got double rooms with a camp bed as the third bed, you couldnt swing a cat in there it was so cramped! There was no bar as such to relax in, a cocktail bar (if you could call it that), which never seemed to be open. We arrived back to the Hotel between 11pm and 11.30pm each evening and could not even get a glass of wine as there was no bar open, we were told there was a mini bar in our room!! There was no warmth at all in this Hotel, the only pleasant member of staff was from accommodation and a lovely male waiter at breakfast! On a plus note, the breakfast in the Hotel was very good, although the service was very slow and poor. We would only recommend this Hotel for its location, nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: kmbTokyo
Reviews.Content: We booked our honeymoon for 2 nights at the Hotel. The room was extremely small and had no bath. We asked the Concierge to move us to another room with one inside and were extemely unhappy with the attitude. We understand Italian and couldn't overhear the concierge complaining about us to the Bell boy... They sent us to another room with a room. The view outside was the fire stairs.... This hotel has seen maybe the best years 100 years ago. One thing that came unexpected.. the coffee and espresso at the breakfast buffet is instant!!!! In Italy... instant powder espresso....unbelievable! This place is such a rip off... Marc, Japan

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl55
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a wonderful location , only 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's Square. Our room was very small, but the bathroom was a decent size with a large tub/shower. We were located in the front of the hotel so we did have some street noise during the day, but, we were not in the room much during the day so it did not matter. The only problem that we had was one evening with the mosquitoes. Air conditioning was off for the season so we had left the window ajar , forgetting about the mosquitoes. Well, we left Venice with some big bites on us! Besides that , breakfast was very nice, both hot and cold foods. We sat on the patio each morning and watched all the Venetians go to work. Room was clean, bed was very comfortable, staff was very helpful, but as someone said, very businesslike. We loved that we could call a taxi to take us back to the train station as the charm of lugging my luggage over the cobblestone streets and over the bridges was lost on me. I would recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: raquetinha
Reviews.Content: We had a horrible treatment at Hotel Bonvecchiati during our stay of 5 days in Venice last September. We were given a room to small(room 225) that or we or the bags could fit in besides there were no shower in the bathroom. When we asked politely and in italian that we would like to change from this room we where treated like animals by the recepcionist Mr Francesco that told us that for the price we were paying (290 euros) was what we deserved and that they have better rooms for a higher price. I insisted and we were given room 220 which was dark and smelly and you coldnt open the window because of the fire stairs. Our bed had a hole and when I asked the housekeeping for a change she said I should complain at reception. Here again Mr Francesco and colegue told me they would ask for change of matress what never happended.

Reviews.Title: “a real treat”
Reviews.Author: hobblitt
Reviews.Content: Water taxi took us straight there (previous review people - why didn't you check before getting in the taxi?!) to be greeted with extremely professional reception staff and porter and the most enormous 'standard double' I've ever seen. We were lucky and had a corner room with windows on two sides. Gym was small but functional - my boyf said the weights weren't heavy enough but otherwise fine. Zero ambience in what we assumed was the bar but masses of cheaper and better places within 10 seconds walk so no problem. Breakfast selection excellent, great location, exceptional service, premium quality hotel. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: grumpyArv
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights as part of trip around Northern Italy. The location in terms of access to places is great. However, upon arrival we found the Reception stafff to be very snooty - do not book a Gondola trip through them, they told us 130 Euro's, when if you walk about 2 mins to one of the main areas, you get a trip for 80!. Our room was clean, tidy and of good size, however if you get a room overlooking the canal at the back, ask to be moved. Your view is of the canal , as well as the area local shops etc dump their rubbish, which means you get the local rubbish collection taking place by motorised boat at anything from 5 in the morning! Then there is the laundry boat collecting and delivering all the towls etc , again at anytime from 5 onwards. The noise is very annoying and you'll get no sleep! Oh, then there is the slight fish smell the hits you in the corridors near the lifts, and which also comes into the bathrooms every now and again! This could be a great hotel, if they put a little more effort into things.Of all the hotels we stayed in whilst in Italy for just over 3 weeks, this was the worst.!! - Be aware, the hotel Restaurant is very expensive, even by Venice standards! - I will return to Venice, but will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bonvecchiati”
Reviews.Author: MIKSTV
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel only beacuse it was one of the ones that American Airlines allowed us to stay using our air miles. It turned out to be a great place in an excellent location! We were 2 parents and 17 & 20 year old sons, so we had 2 rooms adjoining. Our water taxi would not take us to the hotel's dock, but only to the Raiato using a lame excuse of low water levels. We assumed he did not want to be bothered navigating the canal traffic near the hotel. But we were only a couple blocks from the Rialto, so we dragged the suitcases to the hotel. It appears this place caters to groups and tours as that is what was always in the lobby. But it was no bother. Desk staff was curteous but very business-like. But always they answered our questions. Rooms were on the small side, but it was expected in Venice where space is at a premium. The included breakfast buffet was nice, a wide spread of cold and hot foods. If you have claustrophobia, use the stairs, not the elevators. At night, the restaurant had music on the outdoor deck which we could pleasantly hear from our 6th floor room. Location was excellent: 2 short blocks from the square. We could get everywhere from the hotel in a few minutes: ferry dock, Rialto, pigeons on St. Marks Square(!), basilica, etc. Don't confuse this with the Bonvecchiati Palace, right behind the Hotel Bonvecchiatti. It's more expensive for the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KDrakeley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in July of this year. We thought the hotel was lovely and very traditional. We had a canal view room which was decorated beauitifully. The room was cleaned on a daily basis and the bathroom was imaculate. The hotel is also only a few minutes away from St Marks square. We also found the breakfast was very good here. The restaurant looked lovely, but we didnt eat there is we thought it was a tad expensive and preferred to wonder the little streets where there are plenty of restuarants. We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but some serious comfort problems.”
Reviews.Author: iampickle
Reviews.Content: We booked months in advance for a mid-July trip. Got a triple bedroom which was two seperate, connected rooms. Hotel location is quite good, about midway between Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's. Staff was pleasant and helpful with a restaurant choice. The hotel restaurant is shockingly expensive although the food and service were pretty good. Breakfast was fine for us. Dining room and lobby are quite nice. The room we had was in the very, very old section. Really disappointing. Looks like about 1950's - which isn't the problem until you get to the bathroom. Tiny, tiny and the shower wasn't really made for showering as the nozzle pointed sideways. Water temperature was tough to get right and the lighting was pretty dim. As other readers have mentioned, there is a persistent, heavy fish smell in the hallways. Not rotten, but it does smell like the fish market. Air conditioning was highly disappointing. We slept 4 nights without any covers, sweating. Of course, we were there during one of the worst heat waves in some time. Overall, we found Venice to be terribly crowded, expensive, and were not inspired during our stay. There is a persistent "tourist trap" feeling. Having been to Las Vegas and Disney World a few times, I think Americans can get about 90% of Venice in Vegas or Orlando, for less than half the $. Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life - ruined anniversary weekend”
Reviews.Author: mrsfoodie
Reviews.Content: We, too, made the big mistake of booking this hotel. I originally booked through Airmiles and they encouraged us to book this hotel as there was an offer of three nights for the price of two. We still paid nearly Â£400 for two nights for what, from its website and the description given by Airmiles, was 4 star. We had the same room as the honeymooners Room 111 - see photos in candid shots section. We arrived in the early hours of the morning and on seeing the room immediately complained but were told the hotel was full and nothing could be sorted till the morning. We had told Airmiles that it was our 20th wedding anniversary and needed the hotel to be very special. I think the hotel has a joke at the expense of anyone on a special holiday! Our horror of the disgusting room, which has no natural light because of the fire exit blocking the window, was heightened in the morning by opening a "clean" towel after a quick shower in the broken down bathroom to discover that the middle of it was covered in dried blood! I arrived at reception in tears (dressed!) and presented the towel to the staff. We were moved eventually to a room which was much nicer but very very small and still nothing like the ones in the brochure or website. It is a dreadful hotel, full of large groups on tours and the food was appalling at breakfast and you couldn't even get a decent cup of coffee and the juice was powdered, reconstituted. We were given a paltry Â£100 refund for our appalling experience but the horror of that room still lives with me - it has taken me three months to bring myself to write this up! The only good thing about the hotel was its location, which is very central. Avoid this hotel like the plague!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marlold
Reviews.Content: Nice location in Venice, small rooms and have to agree with the last review...the Hallways smelled like fish. Not the best smell to walk into when leaving your room. Staff was helpful and aided us when we were having transportation problems. If you get into a jam for a place to stay, can go here, although the Best Western right down the way looks like a better alternative

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Com4tCreature
Reviews.Content: Rooms were tiny and overpriced. Hallway smelled like fish. Very clean. Good AC. Breakfast, lots of food,but not very good. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bpup56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the poorest quality for the money..unless you are there for a group tour and that is what you are expecting...and paying a 'price'. We stayed in their newer acquisition, a bldg. close to the hotel..so the room was lovely...and it should be for 440 euros/night...it was one of the newly renovated modern ones, but hotel itself is not what you think you are getting for that price. The front desk staff was less than accomodating....for almost everything I asked for they were not able to help me..even with a 220 plug to charge my battery...I was told they did not have one...We had been in Italy for 2 weeks and had stayed at excellent properties at similar prices...Altho the breakfast is included, here the breakfast was cafeteria quality...without any personal service at all...if you wanted anything special, it was extra. Again, I got the feeling this was strictly a tour group hotel and for a 'price' it is fine...but not at our price. My original thought was that I would stay at a smaller hotel centrally located and take the best room...not realizing that the hotel itself is not great...The brochure and website show wonderful photos, and I had thought that the best room meant one of the ones in the photo, but not...perhaps this is Venice, but I don't think so...with a little more research, I think there is better out there. The location is good...if you want to stay so close to the square...however, my suggestion is to stay further away..perhaps in Lido or one of the other islands, where it is lovely and the hotels ...are less expensive and nicer...and come into the shopping mecca...because that it what it is...at your leisure...it is easy to travel on the boat/bus system and fun too!..In addition it is difficult to get to this location with your luggage...we ended up spending $130 for a water taxi to take us to the airport rather than walk to the public boat transportation...We had a lovely time in Venice, but learned a lot too.

Reviews.Title: “Fair things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: bkingnorth
Reviews.Content: We traveled around Italy for a few weeks never staying at one place more then two nights.(except ROME) We found venice at this time of year to be very expensive and ammusement parkish. This hotel was very expensive for what you got. Nice, clean but our particular room was comically rediculas. The shower was the size of a sink, and no water pressure. Yes, its europe but for the price of this place.....Yuk

Reviews.Title: “sHAME ABOUT THE ROOM SIZE”
Reviews.Author: ZebedeeEssex
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel through personal reccommendation, but then had a good look at their website to decide on which type of room we wanted. We booked a standard single for our daughter and a superior double for ourselves. From the website it seemed clear that the latter would have a seating area. When we arrived, we found the room barely large enough to move around the bed and only some 12 inches wider that our daughter's. When I complained, I was told that was the way things were. Further pressure elicited the response that there were different grades of superior rooms and that they had a large number of rooms out of action through refurbishment. I was offered one alternative, which was frankly no better, and little sympathy. I never did find out what type of room my daughter had! The other problem was the heat. It seemed to build up in the room during the day and we were reluctant to sleep with the windows open because of the noise. The room had air conditioning, but this wasn't switched on until June! Otherwise, great location and good breakfast. This is the fourth hotel we have stayed in in Venice and by far the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Marylandtraveller07
Reviews.Content: We started our Italian adventure in Venice (late March) and it was magical. The hotel was in a great location, a 3 minute walk to St. Marks square and 10 minutes or so to Rialto Bridge. The room was small but clean. They take their cleaning seriously. I had the Do Not Disturb sign up but they still came in which was a little annoying. Nothing was missing but I did not expect that. It happened in another part of Italy too. It may be a cultural thing. It was a standard room with Venetian period pieces. The bathroom was a fair size. The towels were good and they gave you slippers. The breakfast was FABULOUS! Two large tables full of delicious foods. They had the traditional cheese and meats but also eggs and bacon. There were many pastries, juices, and cappucinos. It was open until 1030am, so you could get by without lunch. The bar was lacking. No one really attended to it. They could have made a lot more money from the guests if they had a bartender there regularly. The staff was polite and helpful. It is not a lavish US hotel but is a good European hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lovetogo999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bonvecchiati Hotel from March 18 - March 23. While the room was clean and nicely appointed, it was small - like being on a cruise ship - the room seemed to be only a foot or so larger than the bed so it was kind of claustrophobic - opening the window didn't help since we saw the wall of the building across the narrow alley.. (We booked a standard room and that is what we got). The room was very warm and stuffy - when we asked how to adjust the temperature, we were told we couldn't and advised to open a window. The room was way in the back of the hotel - we had to go up 2 flights then down a hall, then down 2 flights, then down a hall to get to our room (we doublechecked to make sure we didn't forget anything because it was a long way back if we did). The good: Very very convenient location - it was easy to walk anywhere and everywhere from the hotel. The hotel was clean and kept up well. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and good. We had the ungodly 6:10am flight and the hotel booked us a water taxi directly from the side door of the hotel to the airport so that was very, very convenient. The bad: Be aware that the service is not what you may be used to. Our 3:30am wake-up call never came - luckily we had set the alarm on the television also which woke us up to leave for the flight. When we asked if it was possible to get our boarding passes, we were told "NO". When we asked if we could use our calling cards with the hotel phones, we were told "No, you have to use the public phone outside". After we sat in the lobby one night for over 20 minutes waiting for our friends to meet us for dinner, the desk agent "suddenly" found a fax that had arrived for us 4 hours earlier canceling dinner - we were never notified. So, great location but just know going in that the service may not be what you are accustomed to. I haven't stayed in other Venetian hotels so I don' t know how it compares. But, we had a great time - we were able to explore and see everything, which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Venice fantastica”
Reviews.Author: 2wrinkliesByfleet
Reviews.Content: March 2007 Byfleet, Surrey. We two old wrinklies stayed 5 nights at this super modern hotel very close to San Marco Square. The Hotel cannot be faulted, everything works. Immaculately clean, the Staff helpful and friendly. It doesnâ€™t have a restaurant as such but wonderful scrambled eggs in the Breakfast Room, fried bacon, fruit, juices,cold meats, various cheeses, etc etc with baskets of bread butter and various rolls for breakfast all laid out buffet style from 7 thru 10.30am is quite brilliant and will carry you through until you find lunch or dinner at any one of endless eateries. Even if you love pasta (thereâ€™s plenty of fish) choose carefully â€“ preferably on recommendation from another guest and not from someone whose cousin just happens to own the Restaurant. Theyâ€™re not all as good as they should be and some, how can I put this politely, are costly â€˜consâ€™! Be prepared to walkâ€¦.and walk and walk â€“ the place is amazing, beautiful and the buildings, architecture are altogether something you just have to see to believe. If I had a single Euro for every photograph I took plus all those behind me that I should have taken I could have bought the place. Shops everywhere you look, and if you like masques and ArtigianCarta book-binding paper shops you are in for a treat. Yes, the superfast water taxis are expensive anything from 80 to 110 Euros one way but when you see how beautiful are the Riva type boats you will understand the upkeep costs â€“ lie back think of England and enjoy the ride from Marco Polo Airport to and through the alleyways of this totally pedestrianized and quite extraordinarily fabulous place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MrHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cozy 4 star hotel in Venice. Excellent location near Piazza San Marco. Room was well equipped and very clean, abei a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Bon for Bonvecchiati”
Reviews.Author: DeniseHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: The Bonvecchiati Hotel was an excellent choice for our New Year stay in venice. Lovely receptionist who booked Concerts for us and greeted us daily. Rooms a bit small but lovey atmosphere . Shame no tea/coffee making facilities! Excellent breakfast and staff happy to make your coffee for you so you did not have to have instant from the machine. The location was excellent only 3 minutes walk from St Marks square and 5 mins from the Rialto Bridge surrounded by lots of good shops. venice is not the place to expect good food but lots of Coffee shops and bars all serving snacks. Definately recommend and stay again. The Bonvecchiati Palace is just round the corner and a very modern contemporary design in contrast to the venitian style worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: ss_6
Reviews.Content: Great location is this hotel's best feature. Read the other reviews, toss out the 'best/worst hotel I ever stayed in' reviews and you'll have a good picture. Our room was older and appeared not to have been redecorated in some (long) time. It was spacious, the bathroom was clean and well-stocked with toiletries, and the walls ARE a bit thin. This hotel appears to be comprised of two buildings, an older one (in which we stayed) and a newer one. This led to some confusing elevator situations as we needed to go to the 6th floor in the new building to get to the 4th floor in the old one. Also, the elevators are TINY. A note about security - our room had a very flimsy and old wooden door and old lockset and the in-room safe was bolted to a flimsy shelf. Combined with the fact that you only need to ask for a key for a specific room (no proof of indentity was required) and I suggest that you leave nothing of value in the room. We went as part of a group with people staying in all different parts of the hotel and it seems that no two rooms were appointed the same way. I am only commenting on the room in which I stayed. I would stay here again though I'd ask for a room in the newer section.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Halogen
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel room we have ever stayed in. This coupled with the fact that it was the most expensive hotel room we have ever had does not allow us to recommend it to anyone. The room needed to be completely gutted and renovated. Parts of this hotel seem to have been renovated recently and there was work going on while we were there so this may be the reason some have given good reviews for this hotel. The location was excellent and the restaurant and breakfast was very good. Although coffee from a machine at breakfast was unacceptable. We had to have that outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location. Nice staff. But rooms are very small. We received a non-smoking room which smelled like someone had smoked in the room. Bathroom was nice although tub was very high when having to get into and out of. The breakfast was very good and the seating outside was wonderful. Right next to a canal and bridge. Very nice. The staff was very helpful and nice. Found rooom to be of average value compared to cost since it was small for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the Bonvecchiati Hotel to exceed our expectations. The rooms were a good size and well stocked with toiletries. The hotel is in a great location near San Marco square..but be sure you know how to navigatte the alleys. It's very easy to get lost! The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful at all hours. The included breakfast was plentiful and the best we had in Italy our whole trip. We thought it was definately worth the money and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bonvecchiati is Bellisimo”
Reviews.Author: florida travelers
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful stay at Hotel Bonvecchiati at the end of May. Our rooms were large, comfortable and beautifully appointed and the bathroom had every amenity imaginable - but for those not used to European hotels, bring a washcloth (they don't seem to use them in Italy). The breakfast was very ample - by the end of our Italian adventure, we considered Bonvecchiati's breakfast lavish, compared with the other hotels we stayed at in Rome and Tuscany. The staff was most friendly, helpful and accommodating. The murano glass chandeliers in the lobby and rooms were beautiful. The elevators are good but very narrow. One is larger than the other to allow more luggage. (see one of the posted photos). The location is perfect - very easy to get to from Piazza San Marco and even from Rialto, once you know where it's located. Get a good Venice map. Follow the directions from San Marco in the April 4, 2006 review and you'll see a tiny square just north of the waterway that heads northward from the west edge of San Marco square. That's Hotel Bonvecchiati, next to the Armani store (if you need to ask for directions, perhaps people might know that store). It's where the south end of Calle Carlo Goldoni meets the waterway at Fondamenta Orseola which follows the waterway to San Marco. Now that you've found it on the map, you can get to it from anywhere in Venice. If you take the water bus from the train station, you can take # 1, 82 or N at night to Rialto and walk from there, but #1's stop is best because there's no bridges to maneuver if you have luggage - it's near the gondola site at Calle Bembo on the west side of Palazzo Bembo, whereas #82 and N stop at the east side (on the other side of the waterway). From either stop, use the map to get you to the hotel. I give you these details because there are 3 Bonvecchiati hotels (the Palace, the Hotel and the Residence or Suites) and the maps found through Google mixed them up, so the April 4 review was most helpful in locating the hotel. A word of warning - Venice is a walking city with lots of bridges. It is NOT friendly to wheelchairs and those with bad knees and hips. By the way we found it easiest to get a gondola from Rialto. You can reserve one from the hotel but it was more expensive. And the gondola stop behind San Marco that's near the hotel seems to be used by the tour groups so the lines were long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheTimeMan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to Italky that included two nights at this hotel. Having read the wide range of reviews here, I was concerned. To my surprise the rooms were large (by European standards), very clean and recently remodeled. The desk personnel were helpful, the restaurant good and the location terrific. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: shirley_123
Reviews.Content: Beware when you arrive at the train station! We mistakenly thought that the man who helped with our bags and transport them to the water taxi stand was a porter. Not only did he charge us â‚¬10 for the service but loaded our bags onto a water taxi so the driver could rip us off further. He quoted â‚¬50 to take us to the Rialto which increased to â‚¬65 in his second breath then â‚¬85 to our hotel door. We immediately offloaded our bags and took a water bus which only cost â‚¬10. Hotel was hard to find. We had to ask three people for directions before we actually found it. Hotel was quite tired and certainly not good value for money. Rooms were good sized but no air-conditioning as we were there a month too early. So for cool air we needed to open window which also let in street noise and mosquitoes or left the fridge door open. Housekeeping did not clean they just replaced towels, emptied bins and made beds. The lift was extremely slow. Dining room staff were grumpy and rude, front desk people okay. Good location though, between San Marco Square and Rialto Bridge and close to good shopping. Sure there are better hotels in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Hellohola
Reviews.Content: Service was great. Location excellent. Room was very clean & spacious. We were on the 3rd floor & while we did not have a view from our room, the beautiful decor & comfort of the room made up for that. Staff went out of it's way to help whether we had questions about the room or needed directions. I absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but behind 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, but a couple of unacceptable shortcomings of the room: old ceiling that you can hear clearly people moving above you; very dark in the room Breakfast and mattresses were good

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a budget break”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location for all the major tourist attactions and, despite a previous review, can be reached very easily from Piazza S. Marco. With your back to the basilica and the lagoon on your left, walk to the far end of the Piazza. Just short of the large, arcaded building ahead, look for a walkway through the arcade which has been on your right. You'll arrive next to a "parking lot" for gondolas. Walk to the left around this small basin, following the canal. You'll shortly cross a bridge and the hotel is directly in front of you. In all, from the basilica, perhaps about 500 yards/metres. We arrived pretty late at night and were put into a bakingly hot room with a view of a ventilation shaft and no fresh air. I complained and was told that we'd only booked a standard room (!) but that we could move in the morning. They were as good as their word and moved our bags, while we were out, to a lovely room up in the roof with views over the rooftops - and fresh air. Both the rooms were immaculately clean and, for our budget, very good value. The breakfast was plentiful but not haute cuisine by a long chalk. Awful machine-made coffee and inedible scrambled egg, but the continental buffet was fine. I'd go there again - but do check which room you're booked into to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “bonvecchiati-fantastic”
Reviews.Author: upl
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed for 3 nights. our rooms were spotless and modern although i did see some which were smaller. the service was excellent and i found all of the staff to be extremely friendly. there were no complaints about breakfast, our deal told us there would be a cold buffet breakfast so i wasnt expecting too much but there were scrambled eggs and bacon as well as cereals, cheese, meats and pasta which is excellent by italian hotel standards. the location was amazing and my only complaint is not about the hotel its about the cost of everything else!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Gentility”
Reviews.Author: Lisazona
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, comfortable beds and clean BUT the rooms and bathrooms need the attention of a painter and a few bathroom fixtures could use an upgrade. Our shower head broke off!! So I had to sort of "hose" myself off. We told the staff and I'm sure it's fixed. The staff at the front desk was professional, sort of helpful but not especially friendly. The coffee was bad and the breakfast was mediocre. But there was a certain charm to the place with its delicate chandeliers and antique-like furniture. We enjoyed our stay in Venice a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Bonvecchiati - Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MAH48
Reviews.Content: Have just enjoyed a wonderful break in Venice and stayed at the Hotel Bonvecchiati. The hotel is in a superb location near to both St Mark's and Rialto Bridge. Excellent room with marble bathroom and good breakfast in large dining room. Breakfast could be crowded even early in the morning. I would be more than happy to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, thin walls”
Reviews.Author: kachst
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for the tourist, but of poor value. Close to St. Mark's Square, shopping and walking to rialto, but the rooms are very small and in my opinion is just alright overall. The elevator named "Otis" is so small you have to squeeze in with your luggage and the bellman! Also the location of the hotel is quite noisy. Be prepared for the chuch bells outside your window ringing every hour or more. Not to mention the walls are so thin I think I must of heard about four couples having sex and moaning through the paperthin walls throughtout the early hours of 1-4 a.m. Upon arrival to San Marco you will have to drag your luggage along the streets for about 8 minutes if you don't want to take the 140 euro water taxi which costs more than the room itself. This, I have yet to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much”
Reviews.Author: JaviCAP
Reviews.Content: In my last visit to Venice, due to problems with flights, finally I had one more day in the city, but without hotel, so I started to search last minute offers, and i found in the Bonvecchiati, for the day I needed, an double standard, icluding breakfast and taxes for just 75 euros. I was afraid for the reviews I had read in TA, but finally, I thought that for this price, I would take my chances. And so, after a quick check-in, we went to the room, and found a large room (5x4 metres) and a great marble bath room. The room itself had a double kingg size bed, three chairs, a table, several carpets, ac / heating, 5 windows to calles and a internal yard. All decorated in Venetian 17th style. Breakfast was continental cold buffet. I asked the recepcionist for the real price of this room, without offer, and was told it was 300 euros a night, and so I understood the bad reviews od TA, as this price is too much for a room like this, even in Venice. So my advice is: if you get a room for less than 100 euros, you won't be dissapointed, to tell more, you'll be very very satisfied, as you can't beat the location, the room, the breakfast and the staff for this price, but, if you're quoted more than 150-200 euros for the room, it would be too much, as for these prices you can get better hotels and rooms. Anyway, for 75 euros a night it was a real bargain, and with this price, i wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: queenie52
Reviews.Content: Maybe because we booked this hotel through an agent and not direct but although the general areas of the hotel and the location were fine, the room we were given was dreadful! It was the shabbiest room we have ever stayed in and as this was supposed to be a four star hotel we were shocked. The floorboards needed re-sanding the furniture was out of a charity shop, the bed was so old and lumpy I had problems with my back. The bathroom was a cupboard where the shower had such a narrow tray that it leaked all over the floor so that after it had been used we waded through water to go to the toilet. The damp had caused the door and the wall to rot as can be seen in the picture. We did complain and were told that this was a standard room and if we wanted anything better we should have upgraded. At breakfast some one had dropped a prune on the floor and when I told the waiter, so that noone might slip, he picked it up anfd threw it it in front of me on to a trolley! I thought for one awful moment he was going to throw it in my bowl! When I told the management that the rooms looked nothing like the website he said that all hotels exaggerated on their websites! Needless to say we checked out after two nights - a very expensive stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, and were satisfied with everything... The room was very CLEAN and fully supplied with personals including robes and slippers. Location, Location, Location... As we arrived very tired and in need of a shower, they allowed us our room earlier then expected. We felt the breakfast buffet (which is included with the room) was adequate, as you can not expect fresh squeezed Florida juice in Venice. And again the location was central between St. Marco and Rialto bridge, both within a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Vey good!!! Would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Waiter, leave that wine alone”
Reviews.Author: archpoet
Reviews.Content: Waiting staff were over attentive in the worst possible way. It was impossible to put one's wine glass down without someone jumping to refill it. It was rather hard to attract their attention the rest of the time. They also insisted in replying to my fairly accurate but accented Italian in English that ranged from faulty to excrable. This was not calculated to make me feel comfortable. Portions in the restaurant were tiny, and the ham at breakfast was made of plastic. Room service insisted on sending up tepid coffee with a waiter who didn't speak any English at all - surely rather a mistake when the clientele is resolutely monolingual. They made up for any reduction in the room rate by charging like an enraged rhinocerus for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed three nights in summer of 2004. at first we were a little put off because they said we would be in the annex!! what a great surprise--the rooms were newly rennovated and had lots of room, marble baths and a great view or two canals. it was the best place we stayed in two weeks in Italy. can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for dodgy trattoria recommendations”
Reviews.Author: Wakey77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in January 2005 at the start of the carnivale. The hotel is in a fantastic location just minutes from St. Marks Square. Agree with some of the comments on the decor - it was a bit dated and in need of repair, and 4* is overselling it. One thing to watch - when we arrived fairly late we asked reception to recommend somewhere to eat. He took us down some dodgy alley to a trattoria who were not in least bit pleased to see us. However given that we late we stayed to eat and regretted it. 40 Euro for luke warm fish lasagne (tasted as bad as it sounds) and 2 cans of coke.
